Tafseer: (Never cometh there unto them a fresh) i.e. fresh in its coming, in succession (reminder) never did Gabriel bring revelation of the Qur'an to their Prophet (from the Beneficent One, but they turn away from it) except that they disbelieved in the Qur'an.

Arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنبَاءُ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
Tafseer: (Now they have denied) Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an; (but there will come unto them tidings) the news (of that whereat they used to scoff) of chastisement; it is also said that this means: there will come to them the news of their derision of Muhammad (pbuh) and of the Qur'an.

Arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْاْ إِلَى ٱلأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Have they) the disbelievers of Mecca (not seen the earth, how much of every fruitful kind We make to grow therein?)

Arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Lo! Herein) in the different kinds of fruit (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition; (yet most of them are not believers) they were not believers, and all of them were disbelievers, i.e. those who perished at Badr.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against the disbelievers, (the Merciful) towards the believers.

Arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّالِمِينَ
Tafseer: (And when thy Lord called Moses) it is also said that this means: and when your Lord commanded Moses, (saying: Go unto the wrong-doing folk) the disbelieving folk,

Arabic: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ أَلا يَتَّقُونَ
Tafseer: (The folk of Pharaoh. Will they not ward off (evil)) and tell: will they not ward off the worship of other than Allah?

Arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيۤ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
Tafseer: (He said) Moses said: (My Lord! Lo! I fear that they will deny me) I fear that they will disbelieve in the message I bring to them,

Arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلاَ يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ
Tafseer: (And I shall be embarrassed) because of their denial; it is also said that this means: and my heart will shrink from delivering the message, (and my tongue will not speak plainly) out of awe of him, (therefore send for Aaron (to help me)) send Aaron with me to support me; it is also said that this means: send Gabriel to Aaron so that he helps me.

Arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
Tafseer: (And they have a crime against me) they may retaliate against me because I killed the Copt, (so I fear that they will kill me) because of this Copt that I killed.

Arabic: قَالَ كَلاَّ فَٱذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَآ إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
Tafseer: (He said) Allah said: (Nay, verily) I will not set them against you to kill you. (So go ye twain with Our tokens) with Our nine signs: the hand, the staff, the flood, the locusts, the lice, the frogs, blood, the lack of foodstuff and drought. (Lo! We shall be with you) We shall help you, (Hearing) what he says to you.

Arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولاۤ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And come together unto Pharaoh and say: Lo! we bear a message of the Lord of the Worlds) to you and to your people,

Arabic: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِيۤ إِسْرَائِيلَ
Tafseer: ((Saying): Let the Children of Israel go with Us) and do not torture them.

Arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيداً وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
Tafseer: (He said): Pharaoh looked at Moses and said: (Did we not rear thee among us as a child?) O Moses (And thou didst dwell many years of your life among us) and stayed with us for 30 years,

Arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَافِرِينَ
Tafseer: (And thou didst that thy deed which thou didst) and you killed the person that you killed, (and thou wast one of the ingrates) and you are now ungrateful for my kindness,

Arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذاً وَأَنَاْ مِنَ ٱلضَّالِّينَ
Tafseer: (He said) Moses said: (I did it then, when I was of those who are astray) when I was ungrateful for your kindness.

Arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْماً وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
Tafseer: (Then I fled from you when I feared you) when I feared that you would kill me, (and my Lord vouchsafed me a command) understanding, knowledge and prophethood (and appointed me (of the number) of those sent (by Him)) He made me a Messenger to you and to your people.

Arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
Tafseer: (And this is the past favour wherewith) with which (thou reproachest me) O Pharaoh, but you do not recall your aloofness towards me: (that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel.

Arabic: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (Pharaoh said) to Moses: (And what is the Lord of the Worlds) who is the Lord of the Worlds? Is it me you are referring to?

Arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِن كُنتُمْ مُّوقِنِينَ
Tafseer: ((Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth) the Lord of the Worlds is the Lord of the heavens and the earth (and all that is between them) of created beings and marvels, (if ye had but sure belief) that Allah has created them.

Arabic: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُ أَلاَ تَسْتَمِعُونَ
Tafseer: ((Pharaoh) said unto those around him) of attendants: (Hear ye not) what Moses says? There were around Pharaoh at that time 250 men wearing attires made of silk brocade plaited with gold. These men were Pharaoh's closest courtiers, and they asked Moses: who is this Lord of the heavens and the earth to whom you are calling us?

Arabic: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَآئِكُمُ ٱلأَوَّلِينَ
Tafseer: (He said) Moses said: (Your Lord) He is your Lord (and the Lord of your fathers.

Arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيۤ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
Tafseer: (Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a madman!) They said: who is this that you are calling us to? And who is this Lord of ours who is also the Lord of our fathers, O Moses?

Arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
Tafseer: (He said) Moses said: (Lord of the East) He is the Lord of the East (and the West) and the Lord of the West (and all that is between them, if ye did but understand) if you did but believe.

Arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهَاً غَيْرِي لأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
Tafseer: ((Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest) if you worship (a god other than me) O Moses, (I assuredly shall place thee among the prisoners) his prisons were worse than death, for he used to put people in complete isolation, unable to see or hear anyone.

Arabic: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَيءٍ مُّبِينٍ
Tafseer: (He said) Moses said: (Even though I show thee) O Pharaoh (something plain) a sign that serves as proof for what I say?

Arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّادِقِينَ
Tafseer: ((Pharaoh) said: Produce it then) O Moses, (if thou art of the Truthful) that you are a Messenger to me and to my people!

Arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
Tafseer: (Then he) Moses (flung down his staff and it became a serpent) a yellow, male serpent (manifest) as huge as any serpent can be,

Arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
Tafseer: Pharaoh then said: “this is a manifest sign, do you have any other signs?” (And he drew forth his hand) from his armpit (and lo! it was white to the beholders) his hand had a light like the light of the sun, and whoever looked at it liked it.

Arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
Tafseer: ((Pharaoh) said unto the chiefs about him: Lo, this) messenger (is verily a knowing wizard) who is very skilful in magic,

Arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُمْ مِّنْ أَرْضِكُمْ بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
Tafseer: (Who would drive you out of your land) Egypt (by his magic. Now what counsel ye) what do you suggest that I should do?

Arabic: قَالُوۤاْ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِي ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: Put him off) retain him, ((him) and his brother) and do not kill them, (and send them) i.e. the police (into the cities) the cities where the wizards are found (summoners) to summon these wizards,

Arabic: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Who shall bring unto thee every knowing wizard) who is skilful in magic so that they can do what Moses did.

Arabic: فَجُمِعَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
Tafseer: (So the wizards were gathered together) there were 72 of them (at a set time on a day appointed) which was the day of the market, and it also said that it was the day of their festival, and it is also said that it was the day of their new year.

Arabic: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُمْ مُّجْتَمِعُونَ
Tafseer: (And it was said unto the people: Are ye (also) gathering?

Arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلْغَالِبِينَ
Tafseer: (They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards) that we may follow the religion of the wizards (if they are the winners) against Moses.

Arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَإِنَّ لَنَا لأَجْراً إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَالِبِينَ
Tafseer: (And when the wizards came they said unto Pharaoh: Will there surely be a reward for us if we are the winners) against Moses?

Arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذاً لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
Tafseer: (He said) Pharaoh said: (Aye) you will have that, (and ye will then surely be of those brought near) in terms of status, position and attending my assembly.

Arabic: قَالَ لَهُمْ مُّوسَىٰ أَلْقُواْ مَآ أَنتُمْ مُّلْقُونَ
Tafseer: (Moses said unto them) he said to the wizards: (Throw what ye are going to throw!

Arabic: فَأَلْقَوْاْ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَونَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَالِبُونَ
Tafseer: Then they threw down their cords and their staves) 72 ropes and 72 staffs (and said) i.e. the wizards said: (By Pharaoh's might, lo! we verily are the winners) against Moses.

Arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
Tafseer: (Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely show) of wizardry.

Arabic: فَأُلْقِيَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ
Tafseer: (And the wizards were flung prostrate) they fell prostrate so fast that it looked that they were thrown to the floor, because when they saw their ropes and staffs disappear, they knew that what Moses brought was from Allah,

Arabic: قَالُواْ آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (Crying: We believe in the Lord of the Worlds) upon which Pharaoh said: are you referring to me?

Arabic: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
Tafseer: They said: (The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

Arabic: قَالَ آمَنتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ لأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ مِّنْ خِلاَفٍ وَلأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
Tafseer: (Pharaoh) said, You put your faith in him) you believed in him (before I give you leave) I commanded you to do so. (Lo! He) i.e. Moses (doubtless is your chief) your master wizard (who taught you magic! But verily ye shall come to know) what I will do to you. (Verily I will cut off your hands and your feet alternately) the right hand with the left leg, (and verily I will crucify you everyone) on the bank of the river of Egypt.

Arabic: قَالُواْ لاَ ضَيْرَ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
Tafseer: (They said: It is no hurt) what you do with us in this worldly life will not harm us in the Hereafter, (for lo! unto our Lord we shall return) we shall return to Allah and His reward.

Arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins) our idolatry (because we are the first of the believers) in Moses.

Arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِيۤ إِنَّكُم مّتَّبَعُونَ
Tafseer: (And We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night) take by night whoever believes in you from among the Children of Israel, (for ye will be pursued) Pharaoh and his people will catch up with you.

Arabic: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَونُ فِي ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
Tafseer: (Then Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners) he summoned his police force,

Arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰؤُلاۤءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ
Tafseer: ((Who said): Lo! These) the followers of Moses (indeed are but a little troop) a small group,

Arabic: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَآئِظُونَ
Tafseer: (And lo! they are offenders against us) they have caused our fury and anger.

Arabic: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَاذِرُونَ
Tafseer: (And lo! we are a ready host) we are in doubt, and we will supply weapons.

Arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُمْ مِّن جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
Tafseer: (Thus did We take them away from gardens and water springs) pure water,

Arabic: وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ
Tafseer: (And treasures) wealth (and a fair estate) beautiful houses.

Arabic: كَذَلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِيۤ إِسْرَائِيلَ
Tafseer: (Thus) I do with the ones who disobey Me, (and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them) to inherit Egypt after their destruction.

Arabic: فَأَتْبَعُوهُم مُّشْرِقِينَ
Tafseer: (And they overtook them at sunrise.

Arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
Tafseer: (And when the two hosts) the group of Moses and that of Pharaoh (saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are indeed caught) O Moses, they have caught up with us.

Arabic: قَالَ كَلاَّ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
Tafseer: (He said) Moses said: (Nay) they have not, (verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me) He will save me from them and guide me to the right way.

Arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
Tafseer: (Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And) when he hit it (it parted) into 12 roads, (and each part) and each road (was as a mountain vast) like a huge mountain.

Arabic: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ ٱلآخَرِينَ
Tafseer: (Then brought We near the others to that place) then We kept Pharaoh and his people in the cloud, and it is said in the sea, and all of them were disbelievers.

Arabic: وَأَنجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
Tafseer: (And We saved Moses and those with him, every one) from drowning;

Arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا ٱلآخَرِينَ
Tafseer: (We drowned the others) Pharaoh and his host in the sea.

Arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition, (yet most of them are not believers) most of them were not believers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against the disbelievers, (the Merciful) towards the believers, since He saved them from drowning.

Arabic: وَٱتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
Tafseer: (Recite unto them) unto Quraysh, your people (the story of Abraham) the event of Abraham in the Qur'an:

Arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
Tafseer: (When he said unto his father) Azar (and his folk) the idol worshippers: (What worship ye) Abraham said to them: what do you worship?

Arabic: قَالُواْ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَاماً فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: We worship idols) deities, (and are ever devoted unto them) we worship them and remain devoted to their worship.

Arabic: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ
Tafseer: (He said) Abraham said to them: (Do they hear you when ye cry) do these deities answer you when you call upon them?

Arabic: أَوْ يَنفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ
Tafseer: (Or do they benefit) you in your livelihood when you obey them (or harm you) in your livelihood when you disobey them?

Arabic: قَالُواْ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ آبَآءَنَا كَذَلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
Tafseer: (They said: Nay, but we found our fathers acting on this use) we found our fathers worshipping these deities, and we have emulated them.

Arabic: قَالَ أَفَرَأَيْتُمْ مَّا كُنْتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
Tafseer: (He said) Abraham said: (See now that which ye worship,

Arabic: أَنتُمْ وَآبَآؤُكُمُ ٱلأَقْدَمُونَ
Tafseer: Ye and your forefathers!) before you,

Arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِيۤ إِلاَّ رَبَّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: Lo! they are (all) an enemy unto me) and I disassociate myself from them, (save the Lord of the Worlds) except the worship of the Lord of the Worlds.

Arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَنِي فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ
Tafseer: (Who created me) from a sperm drop, (and He doth guide me) He preserves me on the right religion and guides me to the Truth and guidance,

Arabic: وَٱلَّذِي هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِي وَيَسْقِينِ
Tafseer: (And Who feedeth me) He provides for me and gives me my full when I am hungry (and watereth me) and gives me to drink when I am thirsty.

Arabic: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ
Tafseer: (And when I sicken, then He healeth me) He cures me from sickness when I am sick,

Arabic: وَٱلَّذِي يُمِيتُنِي ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ
Tafseer: (And Who causeth me to die) in this worldly life, (then giveth me life (again)) on the Day of Judgement,

Arabic: وَٱلَّذِيۤ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
Tafseer: (And Who, I ardently hope, will forgive me my sin on the Day of Judgement) on the Day of Reckoning. His sins being his pretending that he was sick, and claiming that it was the biggest idol that smashed the smaller ones and also that his wife was his sister.

Arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْماً وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِٱلصَّالِحِينَ
Tafseer: (My Lord! Vouchsafe me wisdom) understanding and knowledge (and unite me to the righteous) to my forefathers, the messengers, in Paradise.

Arabic: وَٱجْعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي ٱلآخِرِينَ
Tafseer: (And give unto me a good report) a good mention (in later generations) those who come after me.

Arabic: وَٱجْعَلْنِي مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
Tafseer: (And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight) and make me among the dwellers of the Garden of Bliss,

Arabic: وَٱغْفِرْ لأَبِيۤ إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
Tafseer: (And forgive my father) and guide my father through me. (Lo! he is of those who err) he is in error, a disbeliever.

Arabic: وَلاَ تُخْزِنِي يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ
Tafseer: (And abase me not) and do not chastise me (on the day when they are raised) from the graves,

Arabic: يَوْمَ لاَ يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلاَ بَنُونَ
Tafseer: (The day when wealth) the abundance of wealth (and sons) and abundance of sons (avail not (any man),

Arabic: إِلاَّ مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
Tafseer: Save him who bringeth unto Allah a whole heart) a heart free of sins and love for this worldly life; it is also said that this means: a heart free of hatred for the Companions of the Prophet (pbuh).

Arabic: وَأُزْلِفَتِ ٱلْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
Tafseer: (And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil)) disbelief, idolatry, and indecencies, becoming thus their abode.

Arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ
Tafseer: (And hell will appear plainly to the erring) to the disbelievers, becoming thus their abode.

Arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
Tafseer: (And it will be said unto them) it will be said to the idol worshippers: (Where is (all) that ye used to worship) of idols in the life of the world,

Arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
Tafseer: (Instead of Allah? Can they help you) can they help you to avoid Allah's chastisement (or help themselves) or help themselves to avoid Allah's chastisement?

Arabic: فَكُبْكِبُواْ فِيهَا هُمْ وَٱلْغَاوُونَ
Tafseer: (Then they will be hurled therein) they will be cast all together in hell, (they) the disbelievers of Mecca and all the disbelievers among human beings (and the seducers) the disbelievers of the jinn and their deities,

Arabic: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ
Tafseer: (And the hosts of Iblis) the offspring of Iblis, (together) who are the satans.

Arabic: قَالُواْ وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ
Tafseer: (And they) i.e. the disbelievers (will say, when they are quarrelling) with their deities, leaders and the offspring of Iblis (therein) in hell:

Arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلاَلٍ مُّبِينٍ
Tafseer: (By Allah, of a truth we were in error manifest) in the life of the world,

Arabic: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُمْ بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (When we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds) in relation to worship.

Arabic: وَمَآ أَضَلَّنَآ إِلاَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
Tafseer: (It was but the guilty) the idolaters who came before us and whom we emulated (who misled us) who turned us away from faith and obedience.

Arabic: فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَافِعِينَ
Tafseer: (Now we have no intercessors) from amongst the angels, prophets or righteous people who may intercede for us,

Arabic: وَلاَ صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Nor any loving friend) nor anyone close who might be interested in our plight.

Arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Oh, that we had another turn) in the life of the world, (that we might be of the believers!

Arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: Lo! Herein) in that which I have mentioned of their states (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition, (yet most of them are not believers!) that is, if they were to have another turn in the life of the world; it is also said that this means: they were not believers and most of them were disbelievers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo, thy Lord! He is Indeed the Mighty) in retribution against them, (the Merciful) towards the believers.

Arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
Tafseer: (Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah)) i.e. they denied Noah and all the other messengers who were mentioned by Noah,

Arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلاَ تَتَّقُونَ
Tafseer: (When their brother) their Prophet; he was not their brother in religion but only in kinship (Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)) the worship of other than Allah?

Arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! I am a faithful messenger) faithful in conveying the message; it is also said that this means: I was deemed very trustworthy in your eyes before this, so how could you doubt me today, (unto you) from Allah,

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: (So keep your duty to Allah) so fear Allah regarding that which He has commanded you of repentance and faith, (and obey me) and follow my way and religion.

Arabic: وَمَآ أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلاَّ عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And I ask of you no wage) no provision (therefore) in exchange for the profession of Allah's divine Oneness; (my wage) my provision (is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: So keep your duty to Allah) so fear Allah regarding that which He has commanded you of repentance and faith, (and obey me) and follow my advice.

Arabic: قَالُوۤاْ أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَٱتَّبَعَكَ ٱلأَرْذَلُونَ
Tafseer: (They said: Shall we put faith in thee) shall we believe in you, O Noah, (when the lowest (of the people) follow thee) when our most lowly and weak have followed you? We will not believe in you until you repulse them.

Arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعْمَلُونَ
Tafseer: (He said) Noah said: (And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in the past)) I do not know whether it is you or them who will agree with me?

Arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلاَّ عَلَىٰ رَبِّي لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
Tafseer: (Lo! their reckoning) their reward and sustenance (is my Lord's concern, if ye but knew) this;

Arabic: وَمَآ أَنَاْ بِطَارِدِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (And I am not (here) to repulse believers) from the worship of Allah.

Arabic: إِنْ أَنَا إِلاَّ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
Tafseer: (I am only a plain warner) I am only a Messenger warning you of a curse that you know well.

Arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِنْ لَّمْ تَنْتَهِ يٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: If thou cease not) from what you are saying, (O Noah, thou wilt surely be among those stoned (to death)) we will kill you just as we killed the strangers who believed in you.

Arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي كَذَّبُونِ
Tafseer: (He said) Noah said: (My Lord! Lo! my own folk deny me) regarding the message, and have killed those strangers who believed in me.

Arabic: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحاً وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِي مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Therefore judge Thou between us, a (conclusive) judgement) a fair judgement, (and save me and those believers who are with me) from their torment.

Arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُ فِي ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
Tafseer: (And We saved him and those with him) among the believers (in the laden ship) and it was only waiting to sail away.

Arabic: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ ٱلْبَاقِينَ
Tafseer: (Then afterward We drowned the others) i.e. the rest of his people, after Noah boarded the ship.

Arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Lo! Herein) in that which We did with them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition to those who came after them, (yet most of them are not believers) they were not believers and most of them were disbelievers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo, thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against them when He drowned them, (the Merciful) towards the believers when He saved them from drowning.

Arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
Tafseer: ((The tribe of) 'Aad denied the messengers (of Allah)) the people of Hud denied Hud as well as all the messenger whom Hud had mentioned to them,

Arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلاَ تَتَّقُونَ
Tafseer: (When their brother) their Prophet (Hud said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)) the worship of other than Allah?

Arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! I am a faithful messenger) I am faithful regarding the message (unto you) from Allah,

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: (So keep your duty to Allah) so obey Allah regarding that which He has commanded you of repentance and faith (and obey me) in that which I command you.

Arabic: وَمَآ أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلاَّ عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And I ask of you no wage) no payment (therefore) for professing Allah's divine Oneness; (my wage) my reward (is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

Arabic: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ آيَةً تَعْبَثُونَ
Tafseer: Build ye on every high place a monument for vain delight?) you beat up any stranger who passes by you and steal his clothes; this can also be understood in this manner: do you build in every marketplace a sign by means of which you scoff at whoever passes by you?

Arabic: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ
Tafseer: (And seek ye out strongholds) houses, palaces and pools, (that haply ye may last for ever) in this worldly life? Nay, you will not last for ever!

Arabic: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُمْ بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ
Tafseer: (And if ye seize by force, seize ye as tyrants?) And when you punish, you do so in the manner of the tyrants: you beat up and kill in a state of anger.

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: (Rather keep your duty to Allah) rather, fear Allah regarding that which He has commanded you of repentance and faith, (and obey me) and follow my way.

Arabic: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱلَّذِيۤ أَمَدَّكُمْ بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ
Tafseer: (Keep your duty towards Him) fear Him (who hath aided) provided (you with (the good things) that ye know),

Arabic: أَمَدَّكُمْ بِأَنْعَامٍ وَبَنِينَ
Tafseer: Then He explained what He provided them with, saying: (Hath aided ye with cattle and sons) He gave you cattle and sons.

Arabic: وَجَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
Tafseer: (And gardens and water springs) and pure water.

Arabic: إِنِّيۤ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Lo! I fear for you) I know you will be visited by (the retribution of an awful day) in the Fire, if you do not repent of disbelief, idolatry and idol worship.

Arabic: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُنْ مِّنَ ٱلْوَاعِظِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: It is all one to us whether thou preachest) you warn us (or art not of those who preach) or you are a warner to us;

Arabic: إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلاَّ خُلُقُ ٱلأَوَّلِينَ
Tafseer: (This) that in which we are now (is but a fable of the men of old) the religion of the people of old; the religion of our forefathers; it is also said that this means: what you say is nothing but the invention of the people of old,

Arabic: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
Tafseer: (And we shall not be doomed) for adhering to this religion, as you claim.

Arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (And they denied him) they disbelieved in his message and in what he said to them; (therefore We destroyed them) by the wind. (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition to those who came after them, (yet most of them are not believers) they were not believers and most of them were disbelievers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against the disbelievers, (the Merciful) towards the believers, for He saved them from the wind.

Arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
Tafseer: ((The tribe of) Thamud denied the messengers (of Allah)) the people of Salih denied Salih just as they denied all the messengers that Salih mentioned to them.

Arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلا تَتَّقُونَ
Tafseer: (When their brother) their Prophet (Salih said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)) the worship of other than Allah?

Arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you) I am a Messenger from Allah to you, and I am faithful as regards the message I bring,

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: (So keep your duty to Allah) so fear Allah regarding that which He commanded you of repentance and faith (and obey me) and follow my way and religion.

Arabic: وَمَآ أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلاَّ عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And I ask of you no wage) no payment or provision (therefore) in exchange for the profession of Allah's divine Oneness; (my wage) my reward (is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

Arabic: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَاهُنَآ آمِنِينَ
Tafseer: Will ye be left secure) from death, cessation or punishment (in that which is here before us) of bounties,

Arabic: فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
Tafseer: (In gardens and water springs) pure water

Arabic: وَزُرُوعٍ وَنَخْلٍ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌ
Tafseer: (And tilled fields and heavy sheathed palm-trees) bearing ripe and seemly fruits,

Arabic: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتاً فَارِهِينَ
Tafseer: (Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful?) it is also said that this means: feeling proud of, and haughty about, your farms.

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: (Therefore keep your duty to Allah) fear Allah regarding that which He commanded you (and obey me) and follow my way and advice,

Arabic: وَلاَ تُطِيعُوۤاْ أَمْرَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
Tafseer: (And obey not the command of the prodigal) and obey not the words of the idolaters,

Arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي ٱلأَرْضِ وَلاَ يُصْلِحُونَ
Tafseer: (Who spread corruption in the earth) through disbelief, idolatry and calling to the worship of other than Allah, (and reform not) they do not command righteousness.

Arabic: قَالُوۤاْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَحَّرِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: thou art but one of the bewitched) you are neither an angel nor a prophet;

Arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلاَّ بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّادِقِينَ
Tafseer: (Thou art but a mortal) a human being (like us) you eat and drink just like we do. (So bring some token) a sign to prove what you claim (if thou art of the truthful) that the punishment is coming and that you are a Messenger to us.

Arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
Tafseer: (He said) Salih said to them: ((Behold) this she-camel) she is a sign that I am sent as a prophet to you. (She hath the right to drink (at the well)) one day, (and ye have the right to drink) another day, ((each) on an appointed day) i.e. in alternate days: one day for you and one day for her.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوۤءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
Tafseer: (And touch her not with ill) do not hamstrung her (lest there come on you the retribution of an awful day.

Arabic: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُواْ نَادِمِينَ
Tafseer: But they hamstrung her) they killed her, (and then were penitent) and they regretted killing her.

Arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (So the retribution came on them) after three days. (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition for those who came after them, (yet most of them are not believers) they were not believers and were all disbelievers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo! thy Lord) O Muhammad! (He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against the disbelievers, (the Merciful) towards the believers.

Arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
Tafseer: (The folk of Lot denied the messengers (of Allah)) the people of Lot denied Lot and they also denied all the messengers mentioned to them by Lot,

Arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلا تَتَّقُونَ
Tafseer: (When their brother) their Prophet (Lot said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)) will you not ward off the worship of other than Allah?

Arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you) from Allah and I am faithful regarding the message I have brought to you,

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: (So keep your duty to Allah) so fear Allah in that which He commanded you regarding repentance and faith (and obey me) follow my way and religion.

Arabic: وَمَآ أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلاَّ عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And I ask of you no wage) no payment (therefore) for professing Allah's divine Oneness; (my wage) my reward (is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

Arabic: أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: What! Of all creatures do ye come unto the males) for sexual intercourse,

Arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ مِّنْ أَزْوَاجِكُمْ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
Tafseer: (And leave the wives) and avoid having sex with your wives (your Lord created for you) that your Lord made lawful for you? (Nay, but ye are froward folk) who transgress from the lawful to the unlawful.

Arabic: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: If thou cease not, O Lot) from what you say, (thou wilt soon be of the outcast) you will be expelled from our land, Sodom.

Arabic: قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُمْ مِّنَ ٱلْقَالِينَ
Tafseer: (He said) Lot said: (I am in truth of those who hate your conduct) your evil conduct.

Arabic: رَبِّ نَّجِنِي وَأَهْلِي مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
Tafseer: (My Lord! Save me and my household from what they do.

Arabic: فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
Tafseer: So We saved him and his household, every one,

Arabic: إِلاَّ عَجُوزاً فِي ٱلْغَابِرِينَ
Tafseer: Save an old woman) his hypocrite wife (among those who stayed behind) to be destroyed.

Arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا ٱلآخَرِينَ
Tafseer: (Then afterward We destroyed the others) We destroyed the remainder of his people.

Arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَراً فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
Tafseer: (And We rained on them) on their sodomites and travellers (a rain) of stones. (And dreadful is the rain of those who have been warned) evil is the rain of stones for those who were warned by Lot but did not believe.

Arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition for those who came after them, (yet most of them are not believers) they were not believers and most of them were disbelievers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against the disbelievers, (the Merciful) towards the believers.

Arabic: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ لْئَيْكَةِ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
Tafseer: (The dwellers in the wood (of Midian) denied the messengers (of Allah)) the people of Shu'ayb denied Shu'ayb just as they denied all the messengers mentioned to them by Shu'ayb,

Arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلاَ تَتَّقُونَ
Tafseer: (When Shu'ayb said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)) will you not ward off the worship of other than Allah?

Arabic: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you) from Allah and I am faithful regarding the message I convey to you,

Arabic: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
Tafseer: (So keep your duty to Allah) so fear Allah in that which He commanded you regarding repentance and faith (and obey me) and follow my way and religion.

Arabic: وَمَآ أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلاَّ عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And I ask of you no wage) no payment (for it) for the profession of Allah's divine Oneness; (my wage) my reward (is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

Arabic: أَوْفُواْ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلاَ تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
Tafseer: Give full measure) when you measure or weigh, (and be not of those who give less (than the due)) in measurement and weighing; this is because they were well known for giving less than what is due in measurement.

Arabic: وَزِنُواْ بِٱلْقِسْطَاسِ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمِ
Tafseer: (And weigh with the true balance) and weigh with the balance of justice.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَبْخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلاَ تَعْثَوْاْ فِي ٱلأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
Tafseer: (Wrong not mankind in their goods) do not diminish people's due in measurement and weight, (and do not evil, making mischief, in the earth) do not commit transgressions and corruption in the land by giving less in measurement and weight and calling to the worship of other than Allah.

Arabic: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَٱلْجِبِلَّةَ ٱلأَوَّلِينَ
Tafseer: (And keep your duty unto) and fear (Him Who created you and the generations of the men of old) He created the people of old before you.

Arabic: قَالُوۤاْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسَحَّرِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: thou art but one of the bewitched) you are neither an angel nor a Prophet;

Arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلاَّ بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَاذِبِينَ
Tafseer: (Thou art but a mortal) a human being (like us) you eat and drink just as we do, (and lo! we deem thee of the liars) in what you claim.

Arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفاً مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّادِقِينَ
Tafseer: (Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us) as punishment, (if thou art of the Truthful) that the punishment is coming.

Arabic: قَالَ رَبِّيۤ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
Tafseer: (He said) Shu'ayb said: (My Lord is best aware of what ye do) in your state of disbelief, and He is more aware of you and your punishment.

Arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
Tafseer: (But they denied him) they denied his message, (so there came on them the retribution of the day of gloom) the punishment came in the form of a cloud that stopped above them and burned them with its heat. (Lo! it was the retribution of an awful day) it was a severe day of chastisement for them.

Arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لآيَةً وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition for those who came after them; (yet most of them are not believers) they were not believers and most of them were disbelievers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
Tafseer: (And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty) in retribution against the disbelievers, (the Merciful) towards the believers.

Arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And lo! it is) i.e. the Qur'an (a revelation) an address (of the Lord of the Worlds),

Arabic: نَزَلَ بِهِ ٱلرُّوحُ ٱلأَمِينُ
Tafseer: (Which the True Spirit hath brought down) Allah sent down Gabriel, the trustworthy Gabriel, to convey the message to His prophets,

Arabic: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنْذِرِينَ
Tafseer: (Upon your heart) according to your memorisation; it is also said that this means: when it was recited to you, (that thou mayst be (one) of the warners) by means of the Qur'an,

Arabic: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِيٍّ مُّبِينٍ
Tafseer: (In plain Arabic speech) He says: the Qur'an is in the Arabic usage; it is also said that this means: inform them, O Muhammad, using their own language.

Arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَفِي زُبُرِ ٱلأَوَّلِينَ
Tafseer: (And lo, it is) i.e. the description of the Qur'an and Muhammad (pbuh) (in the Scriptures of the men of old) is written in the Scriptures of the prophets who came before you.

Arabic: أَوَ لَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ آيَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِيۤ إِسْرَائِيلَ
Tafseer: (Is it not a token) a sign for the prophethood of Muhammad, Allah bless him and give peace, (for them) for the people of Mecca (that the doctors of the Children of Israel know it?) That is, when they asked them about Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an and they informed them about both.

Arabic: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ ٱلأَعْجَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And if We had revealed it) and if We sent Gabriel with the Qur'an (unto one of any other nation than the Arabs) to a person who spoke no Arabic,

Arabic: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (And he had read it unto them) unto Quraysh, (they would not have believed in it) i.e. in the Qur'an, because they did not believe in what was in their own language, so how were they to believe in something which is in a different language?

Arabic: كَذَلِكَ سَلَكْنَاهُ فِي قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
Tafseer: (Thus do We make it) the denial (traverse the hearts of the guilty) the idolaters: Abu Jahl and his host.

Arabic: لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلأَلِيمَ
Tafseer: (They will not believe in it) so that they do not believe in Muhammad (pbuh) or in the Qur'an (till they behold the painful doom,

Arabic: فَيَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لاَ يَشْعُرُونَ
Tafseer: So that it) the torment (will come upon them suddenly, when they perceive not) the coming of the punishment upon them.

Arabic: فَيَقُولُواْ هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ
Tafseer: (Then they will say) when the punishment comes upon them: (Are we to be reprieved) from the punishment?

Arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
Tafseer: (Would they (now) hasten on Our doom) the coming of Our punishment?

Arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتَ إِن مَّتَّعْنَاهُمْ سِنِينَ
Tafseer: (Hast thou then seen) O Muhammad, (We content them for (long) years) in their state of disbelief,

Arabic: ثُمَّ جَآءَهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ
Tafseer: (And then cometh that which they were promised) of punishment,

Arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ
Tafseer: ((How) that wherewith) Allah's punishment (they were contented) because of the reprieve (naught availeth them) from Allah's punishment?

Arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلاَّ لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
Tafseer: (And We destroyed no township) no inhabitants of any township (but it had its warners) warning messengers,

Arabic: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
Tafseer: (For reminder) they remind them of Allah's punishment, (for We never were oppressors) by destroying them.

Arabic: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ ٱلشَّيَاطِينُ
Tafseer: (The devils) at the time of the Prophet (pbuh) (did not bring it down) did not bring the Qur'an down.

Arabic: وَمَا يَنبَغِي لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
Tafseer: (It is not meet for them) the devils are not fit to do so, (nor is it in their power) nor could they do this,

Arabic: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ
Tafseer: (Lo! verily they) i.e. the devils (are banished from the hearing) they are prevented from hearing the revelation.

Arabic: فَلاَ تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهاً آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
Tafseer: (Therefore invoke not) worship not (with Allah another god) among the idols, (lest thou be one of the doomed) in the Fire.

Arabic: وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ ٱلأَقْرَبِينَ
Tafseer: (And warn thy tribe of near kindred) your blood relations,

Arabic: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (And lower thy wing (in kindness) unto those believers who follow thee) be kind to the believers.

Arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيۤءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
Tafseer: (And if they) the Quraysh (disobey thee, say: Lo! I am innocent of what they do) and say.

Arabic: وَتَوكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
Tafseer: (And put thy trust in the Mighty) in His retribution against His enemies, (the Merciful) towards you and all believers.

Arabic: ٱلَّذِي يَرَاكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
Tafseer: (Who seeth thee when thou standest up) in prayer,

Arabic: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِي ٱلسَّاجِدِينَ
Tafseer: (And (seeth) thine abasement among those who fall prostrate (in worship)) among those who pray in their bowing, prostration and standing up; it is also said that this means: in the loins of your forefathers.

Arabic: إِنَّهُ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
Tafseer: (Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer) of what they say, (the Knower) of them and of their works.

Arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَاطِينُ
Tafseer: (Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend) with fortune telling?

Arabic: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ
Tafseer: (They descend on every sinful, false one) they descend on every sinful fortune teller: Musaylimah the liar and Talhah.

Arabic: يُلْقُونَ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَاذِبُونَ
Tafseer: (They listen eagerly) the devils listen eagerly to the speech of the angels, (but most of them are liars) the devils are liars because they hear one thing and convey instead 100 things to fortune tellers.

Arabic: وَٱلشُّعَرَآءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ ٱلْغَاوُونَ
Tafseer: (As for poets) 'Abdullah Ibn al-Zib'ari and his host who composed poetry, (the erring follow them) those who transmit poetry relate it from them.

Arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
Tafseer: (Hast thou not seen how they) the poets (stray) they come and go, sometimes eulogizing and sometimes satirizing (in every valley) in every genre and theme,

Arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لاَ يَفْعَلُونَ
Tafseer: (And how they say) in their poetry (that which they do not?) they keep mentioning “I” and “I” when things are not as they say; it is also said that this means: they say things which they cannot do; and hence both poet and narrator are in error.

Arabic: إِلاَّ ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيراً وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِن بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْ وَسَيَعْلَمْ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوۤاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
Tafseer: (Save those who believe) in Muhammad (pbuh) and in the Qur'an, like Hassan Ibn Thabit and his fellow believing poets (and do good works) between them and their Lord, (and remember Allah much) in their poetry, (and vindicate themselves) through Muhammad (pbuh) and his Companions by answering back the disbelievers (after they have been wronged) after being satirized by the disbelievers. (Those who do wrong) those who satirized the Prophet (pbuh) and his Companions (will come to know by what a (great) reverse they will be overturned!) what kind of destination they will return to in the Hereafter, i.e. the Fire, if they do not believe. And Allah knows best the secrets of His Book'.

Arabic: طسۤ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ ٱلْقُرْآنِ وَكِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (Ta. Sin.): '(Ta. Sin.) He says: the (Ta) stands for His might (tawluh) and the (Sin) stands for His majesty (sana'uh); it is also said that it is an oath by which Allah swore. (These are revelations of the Qur'an and a Scripture that maketh plain) this surah consists of verses of the Qur'an and it is a Book that makes plain the lawful and the unlawful;

Arabic: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (A guidance) from error (and good tidings) that they will gain Paradise (for believers) who are true in their faith.

Arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلاَةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَاةَ وَهُم بِٱلآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
Tafseer: Allah then showed the attributes of these true believers, saying: (Who establish worship) those who complete the five daily prayers along with their necessary ritual ablution, bowing, prostrating and all that which is obligated in their due times (and pay the poor-due) from their wealth (and are sure of) they believe in (the Hereafter) resurrection after death, Paradise and hell.

Arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلآخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
Tafseer: (Lo! as for those who believe not in the Hereafter) those who do not believe in resurrection after death: Abu Jahl and his host, (We have made their works fair-seeming unto them) in their state of disbelief (so that they are all astray) so they proceed blindly, unable to see.

Arabic: أُوْلَـٰئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوۤءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِي ٱلآخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلأَخْسَرُونَ
Tafseer: (Those) who have this attribute (are they for whom is the worst of punishment) a severe chastisement in the Fire, (and in the Hereafter) on the Day of Judgement (they will be the greatest losers) they will loose Paradise and enter the Fire.

Arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلْقُرْآنَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Lo! as for thee) O Muhammad, (thou verily receivest the Qur'an) He says: Gabriel comes down to you with the Qur'an (from the presence of One Wise) in His command and judgement, (Aware) of His created beings.

Arabic: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لأَهْلِهِ إِنِّيۤ آنَسْتُ نَاراً سَآتِيكُمْ مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ آتِيكُمْ بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
Tafseer: ((Remember) when Moses said unto his household) when he became unsure about the way: (Lo! I spy afar off a fire) on the left side of the road; stay here (I will bring you tidings thence) news about the right way to take, (or bring to you a borrowed flame that ye may warm yourselves) because this happened in a cold winter.

Arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِيَ أَن بُورِكَ مَن فِي ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَانَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (But when he reached it, he was called, saying: Blessed is whosoever is in the Fire) blessed is the Fire (and whosoever is round about it) of angels! This is the reading of Ubayy and 'Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud; it is also said that this means: blessed is He Who lightened this light; and it also said that this means: blessed is he who is seeking, i.e. Moses and whoever is around him of angels, (And glorified be Allah) He exonerated Himself, (the Lord of the Worlds!) the Master of the jinn and human beings.

Arabic: يٰمُوسَىٰ إِنَّهُ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
Tafseer: (O Moses! Lo! it is I) Who is calling you, (Allah, the Mighty) in retribution against those who do not believe in Me, (the Wise) in My command and judgement, I command that none should be worshipped besides Me.

Arabic: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِراً وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ يٰمُوسَىٰ لاَ تَخَفْ إِنِّي لاَ يَخَافُ لَدَيَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
Tafseer: (And throw down thy staff) from your hand! And he threw it, (But when he saw it writhing) moving (as it were a demon) like a serpent which is neither big nor small, (he turned to flee headlong) from it and did not look back out of fear; but Allah said to him: (O Moses! Fear not! Lo! the emissaries fear not in My presence,

Arabic: إِلاَّ مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْناً بَعْدَ سُوۤءٍ فَإِنِّي غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
Tafseer: Save him who hath done wrong and afterward hath changed evil for good. And lo! I am Forgiving) I forgive the one who repents, (Merciful) I show mercy towards he who dies in a state of repentance.

Arabic: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوۤءٍ فِي تِسْعِ آيَاتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُواْ قَوْماً فَاسِقِينَ
Tafseer: (And put thy hand into the bosom of thy robe) in your armpit, (it will come forth white but unhurt) without having contracted leprosy. Go! ((This will be one) among nine tokens) go with nine signs (unto Pharaoh and his people) the Copts. (Lo! they were ever evil-living folk) they were disbelievers.

Arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْهُمْ آيَاتُنَا مُبْصِرَةً قَالُواْ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
Tafseer: (But when Our tokens came unto them) when Moses went with our tokens to them, (plain to see) demonstrating, one after the other, (they said: This is mere magic) what you have brought us, O Moses, is a manifest lie,

Arabic: وَجَحَدُواْ بِهَا وَٱسْتَيْقَنَتْهَآ أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْماً وَعُلُوّاً فَٱنْظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
Tafseer: (And they denied them) they denied the tokens, (though their souls acknowledged them) after being accepted by their souls that they were from Allah, (for spite) out of opposition and enmity (and arrogance) and haughtiness and pride. (Then see) O Muhammad (the nature of the consequence for the wrong-doers) how was the end result of the idolaters, Pharaoh and his people, how We destroyed them in the sea!

Arabic: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا دَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ عِلْماً وَقَالاَ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِي فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (And We verily gave knowledge) and understanding through prophethood and judgeship (unto David) the son of Jesse (and Solomon) the son of David, (and they said) both of them: (Praise be to Allah) thanks and gratitude to Allah, (Who hath preferred us) through knowledge and prophethood (above many of His believing slaves!

Arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَانُ دَاوُودَ وَقَالَ يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنطِقَ ٱلطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْفَضْلُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
Tafseer: And Solomon was David's heir) as king instead of all the other sons of David who were 19 in number. (And he said) Solomon said: (O mankind! Lo! we have been taught) we were given the understanding of (the language of birds, and have been given (abundance) of all things) and we were given the knowledge of everything in my kingdom. (This surely is evident favour) this is surely a great blessing from Allah.

Arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسْلَيْمَانَ جُنُودُهُ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلإِنْس وَٱلطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
Tafseer: (And there were gathered together) and made subservient (unto Solomon his armies of the jinn and humankind, and of the birds, and they were set in battle order) they were all retained from the first to the last until they were gathered together;

Arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَآ أَتَوْا عَلَىٰ وَادِ ٱلنَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّمْلُ ٱدْخُلُواْ مَسَاكِنَكُمْ لاَ يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَانُ وَجُنُودُهُ وَهُمْ لاَ يَشْعُرُونَ
Tafseer: (Till, when they reached the Valley of the Ants) in Historic Syria, (an ant exclaimed: O ants! Enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his armies crush you) step on you, (unperceiving) unaware of you.

Arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكاً مِّن قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِيۤ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ ٱلَّتِيۤ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحاً تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ ٱلصَّالِحِينَ
Tafseer: (And (Solomon) smiled, laughing) in amazement (at her speech) because he heard her speech while his army did not, (and said: My Lord, arouse me) inspire in me (to be thankful for Thy favour wherewith Thou hast favoured me) you have blessed me with the profession of Allah's divine Oneness (and my parents) whom you also blessed with the profession of Allah's divine Oneness, (and to do good) in all sincerity (that shall be pleasing unto Thee) that you would accept (and include me in (the number of) Thy righteous slaves) and include me with Your righteous slaves in Paradise.

Arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ ٱلطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَالِيَ لاَ أَرَى ٱلْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْغَآئِبِينَ
Tafseer: (And he sought among the birds) he inspected the birds (and said) when he could not see the hoopoe among them: (How is it that I see not the hoopoe) in his place, (or is he among the absent?)

Arabic: لأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَاباً شَدِيداً أَوْ لأَاْذبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
Tafseer: He said: if he is among the absent, then (I verily will punish him with hard punishment) I will pluck out his feathers; such was the punishment of the birds, (or I verily will slay him, or he verily shall bring me a plain excuse) an acceptable excuse.

Arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ
Tafseer: (But he was not long in coming, and he said: I have found out (a thing) that thou apprehendest not) O king! I reached a place that you have not reached and have come to know that which you do not, (and I come unto thee from Sheba) the city of Sheba (with sure tidings) with an amazing, true information.

Arabic: إِنِّي وَجَدتُّ ٱمْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! I found a woman ruling over them) whose name is Balqis, (and she hath been given (abundance) of all things) she has been given the knowledge of all things in her country, (and hers is a mighty throne) adorned with gems, pearls, gold and silver.

Arabic: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لاَ يَهْتَدُونَ
Tafseer: (I found her and her people worshipping the sun instead of Allah; and Satan maketh their works) their worship of the sun (fair-seeming unto them, and debarreth them from the way (of Truth)) the devil has barred them from the way of Truth and guidance, (so that they go not aright) to the way of truth and guidance:

Arabic: أَلاَّ يَسْجُدُواْ للَّهِ ٱلَّذِي يُخْرِجُ ٱلْخَبْءَ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
Tafseer: (So that they worship not Allah) and I said to them: “O you, prostrate to Allah” it is also said that it is Solomon who said: “why do they not prostrate to Allah?” (Who bringeth forth the hidden in the heavens) the rain (and the earth) vegetation, (and knoweth what ye hide) of good and evil (and what ye proclaim) of good and evil,

Arabic: ٱللَّهُ لاَ إِلَـٰهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
Tafseer: (Allah; there is no God save Him, the Lord of the tremendous Throne.

Arabic: قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَاذِبِينَ
Tafseer: (Solomon) said) to the hoopoe: (We shall see whether thou speakest truth or whether thou art of the liars.

Arabic: ٱذْهَب بِّكِتَابِي هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَٱنْظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
Tafseer: Go with this my letter and throw it down unto them; then turn away) then move away such that they do not see you (and see what (answer) they return) when they read my letter,

Arabic: قَالَتْ يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلأُ إِنِّيۤ أُلْقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَابٌ كَرِيمٌ
Tafseer: He did as Solomon commanded, and Balqis took the letter and went to meet her entourage. ((The Queen of Sheba) said: O chieftains! Lo! there hath been thrown unto me a noble letter) a sealed letter.

Arabic: إِنَّهُ مِن سُلَيْمَانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
Tafseer: (Lo! it is from Solomon, and lo! it is) the first line of it is: (In the name of Allah the Beneficent, the Merciful;

Arabic: أَلاَّ تَعْلُواْ عَلَيَّ وَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
Tafseer: Exalt not yourselves against me) feel not too haughty towards me, (but come unto me as those who surrender) and seek peace; as well as demanding other things which were mentioned in the letter.

Arabic: قَالَتْ يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلأُ أَفْتُونِي فِيۤ أَمْرِي مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْراً حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
Tafseer: (She said: O chieftains! Pronounce for me in my case) inform me about what I should do; it is also said that this means: advise me about what to do. (I decide no case) I will not do anything (till ye are present with me) and advise me.

Arabic: قَالُواْ نَحْنُ أُوْلُو قُوَّةٍ وَأُولُو بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَٱلأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَٱنظُرِي مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
Tafseer: (They said: We are lords of might) we have weapons (and lords of great prowess) in war, (but it is for thee to command) we shall follow your command; (so consider what thou wilt command) and we will do it.

Arabic: قَالَتْ إِنَّ ٱلْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُواْ قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوۤاْ أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَآ أَذِلَّةً وَكَذٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
Tafseer: Then she pronounced words of wisdom. (She said: Lo! Kings) worldly kings, (when they enter a township) by force in instances of war and fighting, (ruin it) destroy it (and make the honour of its people shame) by beating, killing and exposing them to other things. (Thus will they do) Allah said: this is how worldly kings behave because of arrogance.

Arabic: وَإِنِّي مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِمْ بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
Tafseer: (But lo! I am going to send a present unto them) to Solomon, (and to see with what (answer) the messengers return.

Arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَآ آتَانِيَ ٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّآ آتَاكُمْ بَلْ أَنتُمْ بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
Tafseer: So when (the envoy) came unto Solomon) when her envoy went to Solomon, ((the King) said: What! Would ye help me with wealth) with a gift? (But that which Allah hath given me) of prophethood and kingship (is better than that which He hath given you) of wealth. (Nay it is ye (and not I) who exult in your gift) if it were to be returned to you.

Arabic: ٱرْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍ لاَّ قِبَلَ لَهُمْ بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَآ أَذِلَّةً وَهُمْ صَاغِرُونَ
Tafseer: (Return unto them) with their gift. (We verily shall come unto them with hosts) armies (that they cannot resist) which they have no power to stop, (and we shall drive them out from thence) from Sheba (with shame) with their hands tied to their necks, (and they will be abased) humiliated.

Arabic: قَالَ يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلأُ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِي بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
Tafseer: (He said) Solomon said: (O chiefs! Which of you will bring me her throne before they come unto me, surrendering) and seeking peace?

Arabic: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌ مِّن ٱلْجِنِّ أَنَاْ آتِيكَ بِهِ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ وَإِنِّي عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِيٌّ أَمِينٌ
Tafseer: (A) mighty (stalwart of the jinn) called 'Amr (said: I will bring it thee before thou canst rise from your place) before you leave your seat of judgement, for he used to sit for judgements until noon. (Lo! I verily am strong and trusty for such work) even though it is adorned with gems, pearls, gold and silver.

Arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِي عِندَهُ عِلْمٌ مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَابِ أَنَاْ آتِيكَ بِهِ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ فَلَمَّا رَآهُ مُسْتَقِرّاً عِندَهُ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّي لِيَبْلُوَنِيۤ أَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّي غَنِيٌّ كَرِيمٌ
Tafseer: Solomon said: I want it even quicker than that. (One with whom was knowledge of the Scripture) one who knew Allah's greatest name, O Living, O Subsistent, who was called Asaf Ibn Barkhiyya (said: I will bring it thee before thy gaze returneth unto thee) before that thing which you see from far reaches you. (And when he saw it set in his presence) i.e. when he saw her throne next to his, (Solomon said) to Asaf: (This is of the bounty of my Lord) this is of the favour of my Lord, (that He may try me whether I give thanks) for his blessings (or am ungrateful) or whether I abstain from being grateful for His blessings. (Whosoever giveth thanks) for Allah's blessings (he only giveth thanks for (the good of) his own soul) for the reward of his Lord: (and whosoever is ungrateful) for the blessing of His Lord, he harms only his soul. (For lo! my Lord is Absolute in independence) of his gratitude, (Bountiful) He forgives whoever repents, and He does not hasten his punishment.

Arabic: قَالَ نَكِّرُواْ لَهَا عَرْشَهَا نَنظُرْ أَتَهْتَدِيۤ أَمْ تَكُونُ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لاَ يَهْتَدُونَ
Tafseer: (He said: Disguise her throne for her) add to her throne and take away from it (that we may see whether she will go aright) whether she will know (or be of those not rightly guided) or whether she will not know.

Arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ قِيلَ أَهَكَذَا عَرْشُكِ قَالَتْ كَأَنَّهُ هُوَ وَأُوتِينَا ٱلْعِلْمَ مِن قَبْلِهَا وَكُنَّا مُسْلِمِينَ
Tafseer: (So, when she came, it was said (unto her)) Solomon said to her: (Is thy throne like this? She said: (It is) as though it were the very one. And (Solomon said): We were given the knowledge before her) Allah has given me [knowledge], by changing her throne and bringing to me, even before she arrived, (and we had surrendered (to Allah)) and we were sincere before she arrived.

Arabic: وَصَدَّهَا مَا كَانَت تَّعْبُدُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِنَّهَا كَانَتْ مِن قَوْمٍ كَافِرِينَ
Tafseer: (And (all) that she was wont to worship) the sun (instead of Allah hindered her) Solomon stopped her; it is also said that this means: Allah stopped her, (for she came of disbelieving folk) her folk were Zoroastrians.

Arabic: قِيلَ لَهَا ٱدْخُلِي ٱلصَّرْحَ فَلَمَّا رَأَتْهُ حَسِبَتْهُ لُجَّةً وَكَشَفَتْ عَن سَاقَيْهَا قَالَ إِنَّهُ صَرْحٌ مُّمَرَّدٌ مِّن قَوارِيرَ قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي وَأَسْلَمْتُ مَعَ سُلَيْمَانَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (It was said unto her: Enter the hall) enter the castle. (And when she saw it she deemed it a pool and bared her legs) she lifted her dress above her legs. ((Solomon) said: Lo! it is a hall, made smooth, of glass) beneath which there is water, so do not be afraid of getting wet. (She said: My Lord! Lo! I have wronged myself) by worshipping the sun, (and I surrender with Solomon) at the hand of Solomon (unto Allah, the Lord of the Worlds) the master of the jinn and human beings.

Arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَالِحاً أَنِ ٱعْبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ فَإِذَا هُمْ فَرِيقَانِ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
Tafseer: (And We verily sent until Thamud their brother) their Prophet (Salih, saying: Worship Allah) that you should say to them: profess Allah's divine Oneness, and repent to Him from disbelief and idolatry. (And lo! they (then) became two parties) one believing and the other disbelieving, (quarrelling) regarding Religion.

Arabic: قَالَ يٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ لَوْلاَ تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
Tafseer: (He said) Salih said to the disbelieving party: (O my people! Why will ye hasten on the evil) the torment (rather than the good) rather than well-being and mercy? (Why will ye not ask pardon of Allah) why do you not repent of idolatry and denial and profess Allah's divine Oneness, (that ye may receive mercy) and escape the torment.

Arabic: قَالُواْ ٱطَّيَّرْنَا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَّعَكَ قَالَ طَائِرُكُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تُفْتَنُونَ
Tafseer: (They said: We augur evil of thee and those with thee) they meant: the hardship that we face is due to your evil omen and the evil omen of those who believed in you. (He said) Salih said: (Your evil augury) your hardship as well as your comfort (is with Allah) are from Allah. (Nay, but ye are folk that are being tested) by hardship and comfort; it is also said that this means: you are forsaken rather than being given success.

Arabic: وَكَانَ فِي ٱلْمَدِينَةِ تِسْعَةُ رَهْطٍ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي ٱلأَرْضِ وَلاَ يُصْلِحُونَ
Tafseer: (And there were in the city nine persons) nine sinful people among the sons of their chieftains: Qaddar Ibn Salif, Masda' Ibn Dahw and their host (who made mischief in the land) through their transgressions (and reformed not) they did not enjoy righteousness nor practised it.

Arabic: قَالُواْ تَقَاسَمُواْ بِٱللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُ وَأَهْلَهُ ثُمَّ لَنَقُولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِ مَا شَهِدْنَا مَهْلِكَ أَهْلِهِ وَإِنَّا لَصَادِقُونَ
Tafseer: (They said: Swear one to another by Allah that we verily will attack him and his household by night) and kill them all, (and afterward we will surely say unto his friend) to his inheritors and relatives: (We witnessed not the destruction of his household) we did not witness the killing of Salih and his household. (And lo! we are truth tellers) they will believe us and no one will reject what we say.

Arabic: وَمَكَرُواْ مَكْراً وَمَكَرْنَا مَكْراً وَهُمْ لاَ يَشْعُرُونَ
Tafseer: (So they plotted a plot) they planned to kill Salih and all those who believed with him: (and We plotted a plot) and We wanted to kill them, (while they perceived not) Our plotting; it is also said that this means: the angels killed them in the house of Salih by hailing stones at them without them perceiving it.

Arabic: فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ مَكْرِهِمْ أَنَّا دَمَّرْنَاهُمْ وَقَوْمَهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
Tafseer: (Then see) O Muhammad (the nature of the consequence of their plotting) the punishment for their plan to kill Salih, (for lo! We destroyed them) through raining stones on them (and their people, every one) and We destroyed every one of their people.

Arabic: فَتِلْكَ بُيُوتُهُمْ خَاوِيَةً بِمَا ظَلَمُوۤاْ إِنَّ فِي ذٰلِكَ لآيَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
Tafseer: (See, yonder are their dwellings empty and in ruins because they did wrong) because of their idolatry. (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition (for a people who have knowledge) who believe in that which was done to them.

Arabic: وَأَنجَيْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُواْ وَكَانُواْ يَتَّقُونَ
Tafseer: (And we saved those who believed) in Salih (and used to ward off (evil)) and used to ward off disbelief, idolatry and indecencies.

Arabic: وَلُوطاً إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَاحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
Tafseer: (And Lot!) We sent him to his people (when he said unto his folk: will you commit abomination) sodomy (knowingly) while knowing it to be an abomination?

Arabic: أَإِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تَجْهَلُونَ
Tafseer: (Must ye needs lust after men instead of women? Nay, but ye are folk who act senselessly) you are folk who ignore Allah's command.

Arabic: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِ إِلاَّ أَن قَالُوۤاْ أَخْرِجُوۤاْ آلَ لُوطٍ مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ إِنَّهمْ أُنَاسٌ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
Tafseer: (But the answer of his folk was naught save that they said: Expel the household of Lot) Lot and his two daughters: Za'ura and Raytha (from your township) Sodom, (for they (forsooth) are folk who would keep clean) they exonerate themselves from sodomy!

Arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ إِلاَّ ٱمْرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرْنَاهَا مِنَ ٱلْغَابِرِينَ
Tafseer: (Then we saved him and his household) his daughters (save his wife) the hypocrite; (We destined her to be of those who stayed behind) We decreed that she would stay behind to be destroyed.

Arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَراً فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
Tafseer: (And We rained a rain) stones (upon them) upon their sodomites and travellers. (Dreadful) evil (is the rain of those who have been warned) by Lot but did not believe in him.

Arabic: قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلاَمٌ عَلَىٰ عِبَادِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱصْطَفَىٰ ءَآللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
Tafseer: (Say) O Muhammad: (Praise be to Allah) thanks and gratitude to Allah for their destruction, (and peace) happiness and safety (be on His slaves whom He hath chosen!) whom He selected for prophethood; it is also said that this means: Allah selected them for Islam, and these are the community of Muhammad (pbuh) (Is Allah best) say, O Muhammad, to the people of Mecca: is the worship of Allah better, (or (all) that ye ascribe as partners (unto Him)) or the worship of the idols which they associate with Allah?

Arabic: أَمَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُمْ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَنبَتْنَا بِهِ حَدَآئِقَ ذَاتَ بَهْجَةٍ مَّا كَانَ لَكُمْ أَن تُنبِتُواْ شَجَرَهَا أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ يَعْدِلُونَ
Tafseer: (Is not He (best) who created the heavens and the earth, and sendeth down for you water) rain (from the sky wherewith) by means of the rain (We cause to spring forth joyous) seemly (orchards) that which surrounds them of palm-trees and trees, (whose trees it never hath been yours to cause to grow) you never had the power to grow its trees. (Is there any God beside Allah) who has done this? (Nay, but they are folk who ascribe equals (unto Him)) they make the idols as equals to Him!

Arabic: أَمَّن جَعَلَ ٱلأَرْضَ قَرَاراً وَجَعَلَ خِلاَلَهَآ أَنْهَاراً وَجَعَلَ لَهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ حَاجِزاً أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱلله بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لاَ يَعْلَمُونَ
Tafseer: (Is not He (best) Who made the earth a fixed abode, and placed rivers in the folds thereof) in the middle thereof, (and placed firm hills therein) on earth, (and hath set a barrier) preventing mixture (between the two seas) the sweet and salty seas? (Is there any God beside Allah) who has done this? (Nay, but most of them know not) most of them believe not!

Arabic: أَمَّن يُجِيبُ ٱلْمُضْطَرَّ إِذَا دَعَاهُ وَيَكْشِفُ ٱلسُّوۤءَ وَيَجْعَلُكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ ٱلأَرْضِ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ قَلِيلاً مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
Tafseer: (Is not He (best) who answereth the wronged one) in his distress (when he crieth unto Him) to drive away his misfortune (and removeth the evil) by removing misfortunes, (and hath made you vicegerents of the earth) the dwellers of the earth after the destruction of its people? (Is there any God beside Allah) who did this? (Little do they reflect!) they derive no admonition at all from this.

Arabic: أَمَّن يَهْدِيكُمْ فِي ظُلُمَاتِ ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ وَمَن يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَاحَ بُشْرَاً بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ تَعَالَى ٱللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
Tafseer: (Is not He (best) Who guideth you) Who saves you (in the darkness of the land and the sea) from the turmoil of the land and the sea when you travel, (He Who sendeth the winds as heralds of His mercy) announcing the rain? (Is there any God beside Allah) who does this? (High exalted be Allah) Allah absolves Himself (from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)) of idols!

Arabic: أَمَّن يَبْدَؤُاْ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعيدُهُ وَمَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وٱلأَرْضِ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ قُلْ هَاتُواْ بُرْهَانَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
Tafseer: (Is not He (best), Who produceth creation) He Who begins creation from a sperm drop, (then reproduceth it) after death, (and Who provideth for you from the heaven) through rain (and the earth) through vegetation? (Is there any God beside Allah) who has done this? (Say: Bring your proof, if ye are truthful) that there is any other god beside Allah!

Arabic: قُل لاَّ يَعْلَمُ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوٰتِ وٱلأَرْضِ ٱلْغَيْبَ إِلاَّ ٱللَّهُ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
Tafseer: (Say) O Muhammad, to the people of Mecca: (None in the heavens) among angels (and the earth) among created beings (knoweth the Unseen) the appointed time for the advent of the Hour and descent of torment (save Allah; and they know not) and created beings know not (when they will be raised (again)) from the graves.

Arabic: بَلِ ٱدَّارَكَ عِلْمُهُمْ فِي ٱلآخِرَةِ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِّنْهَا بَلْ هُم مِّنْهَا عَمُونَ
Tafseer: (Nay, but doth their knowledge reach to the Hereafter) their knowledge is in consensus that there is no Hereafter? (Nay, for they are in doubt concerning it) concerning the coming of the Hour. (Nay, for they cannot see it) they are blind, unable to see.

Arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوۤاْ أَإِذَا كُنَّا تُرَاباً وَآبَآؤُنَآ أَإِنَّا لَمُخْرَجُونَ
Tafseer: (Yet those who disbelieve) the disbelievers of Mecca (say: when we have become) scattered (dust like our fathers) before us, (shall we verily be brought forth (again)) given life again and brought out of the graves?

Arabic: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا هَـٰذَا نَحْنُ وَآبَآؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلاَّ أَسَاطِيرُ ٱلأَوَّلِينَ
Tafseer: (We were promised this) which you are promising us, (forsooth, we and our fathers) before us. ((All) this) which you are promising us, O Muhammad, (is naught but fables) tales (of the men of old.

Arabic: قُلْ سِيرُواْ فِي ٱلأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُواْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
Tafseer: Say) O Muhammad, to the people of Mecca: (Travel in the land and see) and take admonition from (the nature of the sequel for the guilty) how was the end of the idolaters!

Arabic: وَلاَ تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلاَ تَكُن فِي ضَيْقٍ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
Tafseer: (And grieve thou not) O Muhammad (for them) if they do not believe; it is also said that this means: do not grieve for their destruction, (nor be in distress because of what they plot (against you)) and do not be grieved because of what they do and say against you.

Arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
Tafseer: (And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled)) when will come this promise that you so often promised us, (if ye are truthful) that the torment is coming?

Arabic: قُلْ عَسَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعْضُ ٱلَّذِي تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
Tafseer: (Say) to them, O Muhammad: (It may be) and “may be” when it comes from Allah denotes necessity (that a part of that which ye would hasten on) of punishment at the Day of Badr (is close behind you) is coming soon.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لاَ يَشْكُرُونَ
Tafseer: (Lo! thy Lord) O Muhammad (is full of bounty for mankind) for deferring His punishment, (but most of them do not give thanks) for the deferment of punishment.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
Tafseer: (Lo! thy Lord) O Muhammad (knoweth surely all that their bosoms hide) of hatred and enmity, (and all that they proclaim) and all that they display of disbelief, idolatry and aggression.

Arabic: وَمَا مِنْ غَآئِبَةٍ فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلأَرْضِ إِلاَّ فِي كِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
Tafseer: (And there is nothing hidden) secret (in the heaven or the earth) from the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth (but it is in a clear Record) recorded in the Preserved or Guarded Tablet.

Arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْآنَ يَقُصُّ عَلَىٰ بَنِيۤ إِسْرَائِيلَ أَكْثَرَ ٱلَّذِي هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
Tafseer: (Lo! this Qur'an) which you recite to them, O Muhammad, (narrateth unto the Children of Israel) explains to Jews and Christians (most of that concerning which they differ) most of that which they oppose concerning Religion.

Arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلْمُؤمِنِينَ
Tafseer: (And lo! It) i.e. the Qur'an (is a guidance) from error (and a mercy) shielding from the torment (for believers) in Muhammad (pbuh) and in the Qur'an.

Arabic: إِن رَبَّكَ يَقْضِي بَيْنَهُم بِحُكْمِهِ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
Tafseer: (Lo! thy Lord will judge between them) between the Jews and Christians (of His wisdom) by His judgement and decree on the Day of Judgement, (and He is the Mighty) in retribution against them, (the Knower) He knows them and knows their punishment.

Arabic: فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ إِنَّكَ عَلَى ٱلْحَقِّ ٱلْمُبِينِ
Tafseer: (Therefore) O Muhammad (put thy trust in Allah, for thou (standest) on the plain Truth) Islam.

Arabic: إِنَّكَ لاَ تُسْمِعُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَلاَ تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْاْ مُدْبِرِينَ
