Tafseer: (In what statement) in what Scripture, (after this) after the Book of Allah, (will they believe) if they do not believe in these tidings?'

Arabic: عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (Whereof do they question one another?): He says: 'what are they-meaning the people of Quraysh-talking about?'

Arabic: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
Tafseer: ((It is) of the awful tidings) they are talking about the tidings of the noble, glorious and great Qur'an,

Arabic: ٱلَّذِي هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ
Tafseer: (Concerning which they are in disagreement) some of them disbelieve in Muhammad (pbuh) and in the Qur'an while others believe in them. This is because whenever Gabriel brought down a section of the Qur'an to the Prophet (pbuh) and he recited it to them, they used to talk about it, and some of them would believe while others would persist in their disbelief.

Arabic: كَلاَّ سَيَعْلَمُونَ
Tafseer: (Nay) this is a reply to the disbelievers, (but they will come to know!) They will come to know upon the advent of death what will be done with them.

Arabic: ثُمَّ كَلاَّ سَيَعْلَمُونَ
Tafseer: (Nay) truly, (again, but they will come to know!) They will come to know in the grave what will be done with them. This is a threat from Allah to those who disbelieved in Muhammad (pbuh) and in the Qur'an.

Arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ ٱلأَرْضَ مِهَٰداً
Tafseer: Allah then mentioned the blessings He bestowed upon them, saying: (Have We not made the earth an expanse) and a place to sleep,

Arabic: وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَوْتَاداً
Tafseer: (And the high hills bulwarks) for it so that it does not sway?

Arabic: وَخَلَقْنَاكُمْ أَزْوَاجاً
Tafseer: (And We have created you in pairs) male and female,

Arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتاً
Tafseer: (And have appointed your sleep for repose) a repose for your bodies; and it is said this means: nice and beautiful,

Arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيلَ لِبَاساً
Tafseer: (And have appointed the night as a cloak) and it is said this means: a dwelling,

Arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشاً
Tafseer: (And have appointed the day for livelihood) for seeking livelihood.

Arabic: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعاً شِدَاداً
Tafseer: (And We have built) and We have created (above you) above your heads (seven strong (heavens)) seven thick heavens,

Arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجاً وَهَّاجاً
Tafseer: (And have appointed a dazzling lamp) and have appointed a radiant sun for the children of Adam,

Arabic: وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمُعْصِرَاتِ مَآءً ثَجَّاجاً
Tafseer: (And have sent down from the rainy clouds abundant Water,

Arabic: لِّنُخْرِجَ بِهِ حَبّاً وَنَبَاتاً
Tafseer: Thereby to produce grain and plant) to produce through the rain all kinds of grains and plants,

Arabic: وَجَنَّاتٍ أَلْفَافاً
Tafseer: (And gardens of thick foliage) and it is also said this means: different kinds of foliage.

Arabic: إِنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَاتاً
Tafseer: (Lo! the Day of Decision is a fixed time) it is the appointed time when the people of old and later generations will be gathered,

Arabic: يَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجاً
Tafseer: (A day when the trumpet is blown) the blowing of the resurrection, (and ye come in multitudes) host after host and group after group,

Arabic: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَاباً
Tafseer: (And the heaven is opened) and the gates of heaven are opened (and becometh as gates) and becomes different roads,

Arabic: وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَاباً
Tafseer: (And the hills are set in motion) on the face of the earth (and become as a mirage.

Arabic: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَاداً
Tafseer: Lo! Hell lurketh in ambush) the Fire is a detention and prison,

Arabic: لِّلطَّاغِينَ مَآباً
Tafseer: (A home for the rebellious) a point of return for the disbelievers.

Arabic: لاَّبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحْقَاباً
Tafseer: (They will abide therein for ages) they will abide in the Fire for ages and ages, each age consisting of 80 years, each year being 360 days and each day is the equivalent of 1,000 years of the years of the life of the world; it is also said that none knows the exact duration of these ages save Allah, and therefore these ages are never interrupted.

Arabic: لاَّ يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْداً وَلاَ شَرَاباً
Tafseer: (Therein) in the Fire (taste they neither coolness) cool water; and it is also said this means: sleep (nor (any) drink) cold drink

Arabic: إِلاَّ حَمِيماً وَغَسَّاقاً
Tafseer: (Save boiling water and a paralysing cold) and it is also said this means: filthy water:

Arabic: جَزَآءً وِفَاقاً
Tafseer: (Reward proportioned (to their evil deeds)) a reward which is commensurate with their works.

Arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُواْ لاَ يَرْجُونَ حِسَاباً
Tafseer: (For lo! they looked not) while in the life of the world (for a reckoning) they did not fear the chastisement of the Hereafter nor did they believe in it;

Arabic: وَكَذَّبُواْ بِآيَاتِنَا كِذَّاباً
Tafseer: (They called Our revelations) Our Scripture and Messenger (false with strong denial.

Arabic: وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ كِتَاباً
Tafseer: Everything) regarding the works of the children of Adam (have We recorded in a Book) We wrote it down in the Guarded or Preserved Tablet.

Arabic: فَذُوقُواْ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمْ إِلاَّ عَذَاباً
Tafseer: (So taste) the chastisement in the Fire. (No increase do We give you) in the Fire (save of torment) one kind of torment after another.

Arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازاً
Tafseer: (Lo! for the duteous) for those who ward off disbelief, idolatry and indecencies (is achievement) safety from the Fire and nearness of Allah

Arabic: حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعْنَاباً
Tafseer: (Gardens) of trees and palm-trees (enclosed and vineyards,

Arabic: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَاباً
Tafseer: And maidens for companions) who are all of the same age: 33 years of age,

Arabic: وَكَأْساً دِهَاقاً
Tafseer: (And a full cup) one cup after another.

Arabic: لاَّ يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْواً وَلاَ كِذَّاباً
Tafseer: (There) in Paradise (hear they) the inhabitants of the Garden (never vain discourse) oaths or falsehood, (nor lying) they do not lie to each other.

Arabic: جَزَآءً مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَاباً
Tafseer: (Requital) a reward (from thy Lord a gift) that He bestows upon them in the Garden (in payment) ten rewards for each good deed; and it is also said this means: reward in proportion to their good deeds

Arabic: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ لاَ يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَاباً
Tafseer: (Lord of the heavens and the earth, and (all) that is between them) of creation and marvels, (the Beneficent) He is the Beneficent; (with Whom none) none of His slaves, i.e. the angels as well as others (can converse) with regard to intercession until Allah gives them permission to do so.

Arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلْمَلاَئِكَةُ صَفّاً لاَّ يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلاَّ مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَاباً
Tafseer: (On the day when the angels and the Spirit) Gabriel; and it is also said: this is a created being whose tremendousness only Allah knows; Ibn Mas'ud also said: the Spirit is an angel greater than every thing save the Throne, and this angel glorifies Allah each day 12,000 formulas of glorification, and which each glorification he utters Allah creates an angel who seeks forgiveness for the believers until the Day of Judgement; it is also said this refers to a group of angels who have feet and hands like those of humans (stand arrayed, they speak not) to intercede, (saving him whom the Beneficent alloweth) to intercede (and who speaketh right) truly “there is no deity save Allah”.

Arabic: ذَلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمُ ٱلْحَقُّ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ مَآباً
Tafseer: (That is the True Day) in which will happen what I have mentioned. (So whoso will should seek recourse) whoever will believe in Allah's divine Oneness and seek through his belief in Allah's divine Oneness a way of return (unto his Lord.

Arabic: إِنَّآ أَنذَرْنَاكُمْ عَذَاباً قَرِيباً يَوْمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلْكَافِرُ يٰلَيْتَنِي كُنتُ تُرَاباً
Tafseer: Lo! We warn you) O people of Mecca (of a doom at hand) which will surely happen, (a day whereon a man will look) when the believer will look; and it is also said: when the disbeliever will look (on that which his own hands have sent before) have earned of good or evil, (and the disbeliever will cry: “Would that I were dust!”) with the beasts. Because of the horrors, severity and torment of that day, the disbeliever will wish to be turned into dust along with beasts. This will occur on the day when the first trumpet resounds'.

Arabic: وَٱلنَّازِعَاتِ غَرْقاً
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning the interpretation of Allah's saying (By those who drag forth): '(By those who drag forth) He says: Allah swears by the angels who take away the souls of the disbelievers (to destruction) the souls of the disbelievers,

Arabic: وَٱلنَّاشِطَاتِ نَشْطاً
Tafseer: (By the meteors rushing) and it is also said that He is here swearing by the angels who busy the disbelievers with grief and anxiety; it is also said that this refers to the souls of the believers which hasten to come out of their bodies in order to go to the Garden.

Arabic: وَٱلسَّابِحَاتِ سَبْحاً
Tafseer: (By the lone stars floating) and it is also said that He is here swearing by the angels who take away the souls of the righteous slowly and gently and then let them rest; it is also said this refers to the souls of the believers,

Arabic: فَٱلسَّابِقَاتِ سَبْقاً
Tafseer: (By the angels hastening) and He swears by the angels who hasten to Paradise with the souls of the believers and to the Fire with the souls of the disbelievers; it is also said this refers to the souls of the believers that hasten to Paradise,

Arabic: فَٱلْمُدَبِّرَاتِ أَمْراً
Tafseer: (And those who govern the event) and He swears by the angels who govern the matters of the slaves, meaning Gabriel, Michael, Seraphiel and the angel of death. It is said that (those who govern the event) refers to the spears of soldiers, (the meteors rushing) refers to the ropes of soldiers and (the lone stars floating) refers to the ships of soldiers who fight at sea, (the ones who do the hastening) refers to the horses of soldiers, while (those who govern the event) refers to the generals of soldiers; it is also said that (the lone stars floating) refer to the sun, the moon, the day and the night. Allah swore by all these that the two blowings of the trumpet will take place, with an interval of 40 years separating the two blowings.

Arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ
Tafseer: So Allah said: (On the day when the first trump resoundeth) this refers to the first blowing of the trumpet when everything will quake.

Arabic: تَتْبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ
Tafseer: (And the second followeth it) this is the final blowing on the trumpet,

Arabic: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ
Tafseer: (On that day) which is the Day of Judgement (hearts beat painfully) the hearts are fearful

Arabic: أَبْصَارُهَا خَاشِعَةٌ
Tafseer: (While eyes are downcast) abased

Arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَإِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِي ٱلْحَافِرَةِ
Tafseer: ((Now) they) the disbelievers of Mecca: al-Nadr Ibn al-Harith and his host (are saying: Shall we really be restored to our first state) to the life of the world; and it is also said: from the graves

Arabic: أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَاماً نَّخِرَةً
Tafseer: (Even after we are crumbled bones?) Will Allah resurrect us? How is this possible?

Arabic: قَالُواْ تِلْكَ إِذاً كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ
Tafseer: The Prophet (pbuh) said to them: “Indeed, Allah will raise you again from the dead”. (They say: Then that would be a vain proceeding) that would be a failed attempt, because it will never happen.

Arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
Tafseer: And so Allah said: (Surely it will need but one shout) one blow which does not require a second one, and this is the blow of the resurrection,

Arabic: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ
Tafseer: (And lo! they will be awakened) on the face of the earth; and it is also said: in the land of the gathering.

Arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ
Tafseer: (Hath there come unto thee) O Muhammad (the history of Moses) the story of Moses? Meaning: the story of Moses has already come to you; and it is also said this means: the story of Moses has not yet come to you.

Arabic: إِذْ نَادَاهُ رَبُّهُ بِٱلْوَادِ ٱلْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
Tafseer: (How his Lord called him in the holy vale of Tuwa) the name of the valley; it was called so because it was traversed by so many prophets; it is also said: tread (Ta'), O Moses, with your feet on this valley because of its goodness and grace.

Arabic: ٱذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
Tafseer: ((Saying:) Go thou) O Moses (unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath rebelled) he is arrogant and too proud and has refused to believe in Allah

Arabic: فَقُلْ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ
Tafseer: (And say (unto him): Hast thou) O Pharaoh ((will) to grow (in grace)) will become righteous, surrender and believe in Allah's divine Oneness?

Arabic: وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ
Tafseer: (Then I will guide thee) I will call you (to thy Lord and thou shalt fear (Him)) and therefore surrender to Him.

Arabic: فَأَرَاهُ ٱلآيَةَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
Tafseer: (And he) Moses (showed him the tremendous token) the hand and the staff.

Arabic: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ
Tafseer: (But be denied) and said: this is not from Allah (and disobeyed) he refused the message,

Arabic: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ
Tafseer: (Then turned he away) from faith; and it is also said: from Moses (in haste) to his folk; and it is also said: to think what to do about Moses,

Arabic: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ
Tafseer: (Then gathered he) his army (and summoned) and delivered a sermon

Arabic: فَقَالَ أَنَاْ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلأَعْلَىٰ
Tafseer: (And proclaimed: “I (Pharaoh) am your Lord the Highest”.) I am your Highest Lord and the Lord of your idols, therefore, do not leave the worship of these idols.

Arabic: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلآخِرَةِ وَٱلأُوْلَىٰ
Tafseer: (So Allah seized him) Allah punished him ((and made him) an example for the after (life) and for the former) the punishment that he suffered in the life of the world is drowning and the punishment of the Hereafter will be in the Fire; it is also said that this means: Allah has punished him because of his former and latter pronouncements. His first pronouncement being: “I do not know of any other god for you except Me” and the second being (I am your Lord the Highest) and it is said that there is an interval of 40 years between the first and second pronouncements.

Arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّمَن يَخْشَىٰ
Tafseer: (Lo! Herein) in that which We did to Pharaoh and his host (is indeed a lesson) an admonition (for him who feareth) that which has been done to them.

Arabic: ءَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقاً أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بَنَاهَا
Tafseer: (Are ye) O people of Mecca (the harder to create) harder to resurrect and more perfect in your creation, (or is the heaven that He built?

Arabic: رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّاهَا
Tafseer: He raised the height) its ceiling (thereof and ordered it) above the earth;

Arabic: وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَاهَا
Tafseer: (And He made dark the night thereof, and He brought forth the morn thereof) and He made its day and sun clear.

Arabic: وَٱلأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ دَحَاهَا
Tafseer: (And after that He spread the earth) even then He spread it on the water; it is also said: 2,000 years after that He spread it on the water,

Arabic: أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرْعَاهَا
Tafseer: (And produced therefrom) from the earth (the water thereof) running water as well as the water buried deep in the belly of the earth (and the pasture thereof,

Arabic: وَٱلْجِبَالَ أَرْسَاهَا
Tafseer: And He made fast the hills) and He made the mountains firm,

Arabic: مَتَاعاً لَّكُمْ وَلأَنْعَامِكُمْ
Tafseer: (A provision for you) water of benefit to you (and for your cattle) water and pasture benefit your cattle.

Arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
Tafseer: (But when the great disaster cometh) but when the Hour comes, it will tower above everything and nothing will escape it,

Arabic: يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلإِنسَانُ مَا سَعَىٰ
Tafseer: (The day when man will call to mind) when the disbeliever, al-Nadr Ibn al-Harith and his host, will remember and know (his (whole) endeavour) the works he did in his state of disbelief,

Arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلْجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ
Tafseer: (And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth) to him who is ordained to enter it,

Arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ
Tafseer: (Then, as for him who rebelled) him who was too arrogant and proud and disbelieved in Allah, i.e. al-Nadr Ibn al-Harith Ibn 'Alqamah

Arabic: وَآثَرَ ٱلْحَيَاةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
Tafseer: (And chose the life of the world) rather than the Hereafter and also chose disbelief rather than faith,

Arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ هِيَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ
Tafseer: (Lo! Hell will be his home) the Fire is the home of him who is thus.

Arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفْسَ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ
Tafseer: (But as for him who feared) upon committing a sin (to stand before his Lord) his standing before his Lord and abstains from engaging in sin (and restrained his soul from lust) from that which is unlawful, even though he desires it, this refers to Mus'ab Ibn 'Umayr.

Arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلْجَنَّةَ هِيَ ٱلْمَأْوَىٰ
Tafseer: (Lo! the Garden will be his home) Paradise will be the home of him who is thus.

Arabic: يَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَٰهَا
Tafseer: (They ask thee) the disbelievers of Mecca ask you, O Muhammad, (of the Hour) about the advent of the Hour: (when will it come to port?) When is it going to happen? Because they disbelieved in it.

Arabic: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكْرَٰهَا
Tafseer: (Why (ask they)? What hast thou to tell thereof?) What has it to do with you that you should mention it to them?

Arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَٰهَآ
Tafseer: (Unto thy Lord belongeth (knowledge of) the term thereof) the knowledge of its timing belongs to Allah.

Arabic: إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخْشَٰهَا
Tafseer: (Thou art but a warner) you are but a warning messenger by means of the Qur'an (unto him who feareth it) to him who fears its advent.

Arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوۤاْ إِلاَّ عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَٰهَا
Tafseer: (On the day when they behold it) i.e. the Hour, (it will be as if they had but tarried) in the graves (for an evening) the duration of an evening (or the morn thereof) or the duration of one morning'.

Arabic: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (He frowned): '(He frowned) He says: Muhammad (pbuh) showed a stern face (and turned away) his face

Arabic: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلأَعْمَىٰ
Tafseer: (Because the blind man came unto him) when 'Abdullah Ibn Umm Maktum came to him. His real name is 'Abdullah Ibn Shurayh. Umm Maktum was his father's mother. What happened is that the Prophet (pbuh) was sitting with a group of men among the nobles of Quraysh, among whom were his uncle al-'Abbas Ibn 'Abd al-Muttalib, Umayyah Ibn Khalaf al-Jumahi and Safwan Ibn Umayyah, who were at that time disbelievers. The Prophet (pbuh) was admonishing and inviting them to Islam when Ibn Maktum came to him and said: “O Messenger of Allah! Teach me of that which Allah has taught you”. The Prophet (pbuh) turned his face from him because he was busy with these people. When this happened Allah revealed: he frowned and turned away because the blind man came unto him.

Arabic: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُ يَزَّكَّىٰ
Tafseer: (What could inform thee) O Muhammad (but that he might) i.e. the blind man (grow (in grace)) became righteous through the admonitions of the Qur'an

Arabic: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
Tafseer: (Or take heed) by means of the Qur'an (and so the reminder) by means of the Qur'an (might avail him?) It is also said that this means: how do you know O Muhammad, whether or not he becomes righteous and whether or not he benefits from the admonitions of the Qur'an.

Arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَغْنَىٰ
Tafseer: (As for him who thinketh himself independent) of Allah, i.e. the three men mentioned above,

Arabic: فَأَنتَ لَهُ تَصَدَّىٰ
Tafseer: (Unto him thou payest regard) you turn your face to them.

Arabic: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلاَّ يَزَّكَّىٰ
Tafseer: (Yet it is not thy concern if he grow not (in grace)) it is not your concern if these three men do not believe in Allah's divine Oneness.

Arabic: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ
Tafseer: (But as for him who cometh unto thee with earnest purpose) hastening for goodness

Arabic: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ
Tafseer: (And hath fear) of Allah, and is also a Muslim; this is because Ibn Umm Maktum had accepted Islam before this incident,

Arabic: فَأَنتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ
Tafseer: (From him thou) O Muhammad (art distracted) being busy with those three men.

Arabic: كَلاَّ إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ
Tafseer: (Nay) do not do this; He says: do not turn to those who think themselves independent of Allah and turn away from he who fears Allah. After this reminder, the Prophet (pbuh) used to honour Ibn Umm Maktum and treat him well, (but verily it) this surah (is an Admonishment) from Allah both for the rich and the poor,

Arabic: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُ
Tafseer: (So let whosoever will pay heed to it) whoever Allah wants him to be admonished will be admonished,

Arabic: فَي صُحُفٍ مُّكَرَّمَةٍ
Tafseer: (On honoured leaves) He says: the Qur'an is written on scrolls made of skin which are honoured in the sight of Allah

Arabic: مَّرْفُوعَةٍ مُّطَهَّرَةٍ
Tafseer: (Exalted) in heaven, (purified) from filth and idolatry,

Arabic: بِأَيْدِي سَفَرَةٍ
Tafseer: ((Set down) by scribes) written by scribes

Arabic: كِرَامٍ بَرَرَةٍ
Tafseer: (Noble) in the sight of Allah and surrendered to Him (and righteous) truthful; these are the keepers of the nether heaven.

Arabic: قُتِلَ ٱلإِنسَانُ مَآ أَكْفَرَهُ
Tafseer: (Man is (self)-destroyed) the disbeliever, i.e. 'Utbah Ibn Abi Lahab, is cursed: (how ungrateful!) what has made him a disbelieve in Allah and in the stars of the Qur'an, i.e. in the star when it sets; it is also said that this means: how extreme is his disbelief.

Arabic: مِنْ أَيِّ شَيءٍ خَلَقَهُ
Tafseer: (From what thing doth He create him?) He says: let him think about his own person: from what did He create him as a living being?

Arabic: مِن نُّطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُ فَقَدَّرَهُ
Tafseer: Allah then explained and said to him: (From a drop of seed. He createth him) a living being (and proportioneth him) He proportioned his creation by giving him two hands, two feet, two eyes, two ears as well as all the other organs,

Arabic: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُ
Tafseer: (Then maketh the way easy for him) He made clear to him the way of good and the way of evil; and it is also said this means: He made easy for him to come out of the way of the womb,

Arabic: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُ فَأَقْبَرَهُ
Tafseer: (Then causeth him to die) after this, (and burieth him) and commanded to bury him;

Arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُ
Tafseer: (Then, when He will, He bringeth him again to life) i.e. He will resurrect him from the grave.

Arabic: كَلاَّ لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُ
Tafseer: (Nay) truly, O Muhammad, (but (man) hath not done what He commanded him) of profession of Allah's divine Oneness and other things.

Arabic: فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلإِنسَانُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِ
Tafseer: (Let man consider his food) let the disbelieving person, 'Utbah Ibn Abi Lahab, think about the food he eats, how it is transformed from state to state until it reaches him to eat:

Arabic: أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا ٱلْمَآءَ صَبّاً
Tafseer: Allah then explained these different states, saying: (How We pour water) i.e. rain (in showers) upon the earth

Arabic: ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا ٱلأَرْضَ شَقّاً
Tafseer: (Then split the earth in clefts) through plants

Arabic: فَأَنبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبّاً
Tafseer: (And cause the grain) all kinds of grain (to grow therein) in the earth

Arabic: وَعِنَباً وَقَضْباً
Tafseer: (And grapes and green fodder

Arabic: وَزَيْتُوناً وَنَخْلاً
Tafseer: And olive trees and palm-trees

Arabic: وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلْباً
Tafseer: And garden closes of thick foliage

Arabic: وَفَاكِهَةً وَأَبّاً
Tafseer: And fruits) different kinds of fruit (and grasses) and fodder; and it also said this means: straw:

Arabic: مَّتَاعاً لَّكُمْ وَلأَنْعَامِكُمْ
Tafseer: (Provision for you) the grains are of benefit to you (and your cattle) and fodder is of benefit to your cattle.

Arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ
Tafseer: (But when the Shout cometh) when the Hour comes, all created beings will scream and then submit and answer the call. Created being will be abased and know then that its advent is true.

Arabic: يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ
Tafseer: Allah then explained when this will happen, saying: (On the day when a man) the believer (fleeth from his brother) who is a disbeliever

Arabic: وَأُمِّهِ وَأَبِيهِ
Tafseer: (And his mother) and will also flee from his mother (and his father

Arabic: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِ وَبَنِيهِ
Tafseer: And his wife and his children) it is also said this means: when Abel will flee from Cain, and Muhammad (pbuh) will flee from his mother Aminah, and Abraham from his father, and Lot from his wife Wa'ilah and Nuh from his son Canaan.

Arabic: لِكُلِّ ٱمْرِىءٍ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ
Tafseer: (Every man that day) on the Day of Judgement (will have concern enough to make him heedless (of others)) to keep him preoccupied from others.

Arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُّسْفِرَةٌ
Tafseer: (On that day faces) the faces of the believers who are true in their faith (will be bright as dawn) will be blooming due to Allah's pleasure with them,

Arabic: ضَاحِكَةٌ مُّسْتَبْشِرَةٌ
Tafseer: (Laughing) pleased with Allah's bestowal of honour upon them, (rejoicing at good news) happy with Allah's reward;

Arabic: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ
Tafseer: (And other faces) the faces of the hypocrites and disbelievers, (on that day) on the Day of Judgement, (with dust upon them,

Arabic: تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ
Tafseer: Veiled in darkness) gloomy and dark,

Arabic: أُوْلَـٰئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْكَفَرَةُ ٱلْفَجَرَةُ
Tafseer: (Those) with such a trait (are the disbelievers) in Allah, (the wicked) the liars against Allah'.

Arabic: إِذَا ٱلشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (When the sun is overthrown): '(When the sun is overthrown) it is also said that He says: when the sun is turned around as one turns a turban and is then thrown into the veil of light; it is also said this means: when the light of the sun vanishes.

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the stars fall) on the face of the earth,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the hills are moved) from above the surface of the earth

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the camels big with young are abandoned) because they are preoccupied with their own selves,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the wild beasts are herded together) for retaliation; and it is also said this means: when they are dead,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the seas rise) and mix with each other, the sweet seas and the salty seas, such that they become one sea; and it is also said this means: when they become a burning site,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ
Tafseer: (And when souls are reunited) in pairs; it is also said this means: when souls are reunited with their companions: the believer with the maiden of Paradise and the disbeliever with Satan; the righteous with the righteous and the sinful with the sinful,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْمَوْءُودَةُ سُئِلَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the girl child that was buried alive is asked) i.e. when she asks her father

Arabic: بِأَىِّ ذَنبٍ قُتِلَتْ
Tafseer: (For what sin she was slain) for what sin did you kill me; it is also said that this means: when the one who killed her is asked: for what sin did you kill her,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the pages) the registers of good and bad deeds (are laid open) for reckoning; it is also said this means: when they fly about in people's hands,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the sky is torn away,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ
Tafseer: And when hell is lighted) for the disbelievers

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ
Tafseer: (And when the Garden is brought nigh) for the believers

Arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّآ أَحْضَرَتْ
Tafseer: ((Then) every soul will know) every soul whether it is righteous or sinful will know at that point (what it hath made ready) what it has sent forth of good or evil.

Arabic: فَلاَ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلْخُنَّسِ
Tafseer: (Oh, but I call to witness) He says: I swear by (the planets) which appear at night and disappear during the day,

Arabic: ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْكُنَّسِ
Tafseer: (The stars which rise and set) they move at night in the galaxy sweeping away the day and then go back to their positions and disappear; the reference here is to five planets: Venus, Saturn, Mars, Jupiter, and Mercury;

Arabic: وَٱللَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ
Tafseer: (And the close of night,

Arabic: وَٱلصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ
Tafseer: And the breath of morning) and when the morning and brightens come; Allah swore by all these

Arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
Tafseer: (That this) i.e. the Qur'an (is in truth the word of an honoured messenger) Allah says: it is brought down by Gabriel to a messenger who is honoured by Allah, i.e. Muhammad (pbuh)

Arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ
Tafseer: (Mighty) against his enemies, i.e. Gabriel, (established in the presence of the Lord of the Throne) he has standing and esteem with his Lord,

Arabic: مُّطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ
Tafseer: ((One) to be obeyed) i.e. Gabriel is obeyed in Heaven: the angels obey him, (and trustworthy) in conveying the message to the prophets;

Arabic: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُمْ بِمَجْنُونٍ
Tafseer: (And your comrade) your Prophet Muhammad, O Quraysh (is not mad) bewitched as you claim.

Arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ بِٱلأُفُقِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
Tafseer: (Surely he beheld him) Muhammad (s)aw Gabriel (on the clear horizon) on the high setting of the sun.

Arabic: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ
Tafseer: (And he is not) i.e. Muhammad (pbuh) (avid of the Unseen) he is accused with regard to the revelation; and it is also said this means: he is not avaricious.

Arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَانٍ رَّجِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Nor is this) i.e. the Qur'an (the utterance of a devil worthy to be stoned) the utterance of an accursed, rebellious devil whose name is al-Marmi.

Arabic: فَأيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ
Tafseer: (Whither then go ye) from Allah's chastisement, commands and prohibitions, O disbelievers? It is also said this means: why do you lie? And it is also said this means: why do you deviate from the Qur'an and refuse to believe in it?

Arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلاَّ ذِكْرٌ لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (This is) i.e. the Qur'an (naught else than a reminder) an admonition from Allah (unto creation) the jinn and humankind,

Arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَسْتَقِيمَ
Tafseer: (Unto whomsoever of you willeth to walk straight) to whoever wills to conform to the commands of Allah: the belief in Allah's divine Oneness and other things.

Arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلاَّ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (And ye will not) conform with or believe in Allah's divine Oneness, (unless (it be) that Allah willeth) it for you, (the Lord of Creation) the Lord of all that which has a soul and creeps on the face of the earth, from the inhabitants of the heaven and of the earth'.

Arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتْ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (When the heaven is cleft asunder): '(When the heaven is cleft asunder) by the descent of the Lord-a descent without modality-and the angels and whatever He wills of His command,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتْ
Tafseer: (When the planets are dispersed) on the face of the earth,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ
Tafseer: (When the seas are poured forth) into each other, the sweet into the salty, such that they become one sea,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ
Tafseer: (And the sepulchres are overturned) the dead in them are taken out,

Arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ
Tafseer: (A soul) every soul at that point (will know what it hath sent before (it)) of good or evil (and what left behind) of good or evil wont; it is also said this means: it will know the acts of obedience it offered and those it missed.

Arabic: يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
Tafseer: (O man!) i.e. O disbelieving man; here referring specifically to Kildah Ibn Usayd (What hath made thee careless concerning thy Lord) when you disbelieved in Him, (the Bountiful) the Forgiving,

Arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّاكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
Tafseer: (Who created thee) a living being from a sperm drop, (then fashioned) in the womb of your mother, (then proportioned thee) then made your stature erect?

Arabic: فِيۤ أَيِّ صُورَةٍ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ
Tafseer: (Into whatsoever form He will, He casteth thee) if He wills He makes you resemble your paternal or maternal uncles, He can make you handsome or ugly; and if He wills He can turn you into the form of an ape or swine, or the like of them.

Arabic: كَلاَّ بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ
Tafseer: (Nay) truly, (but they) the Quraysh (deny the Judgement) and the Reckoning.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَافِظِينَ
Tafseer: (Lo! there are above you guardians) among the angels who guard and preserve your works,

Arabic: كِرَاماً كَاتِبِينَ
Tafseer: (Generous) who are honoured in the sight of Allah and completely surrendered to Him (and recording) they record your works,

Arabic: يَعْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
Tafseer: (Who know (all) that ye do) and say of good and evil and record all of it.

Arabic: إِنَّ ٱلأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Lo! the righteous) who are true in their faith: Abu Bakr and his believing brothers (verily will be in delight) in the Garden whose bliss is everlasting.

Arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلْفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٍ
Tafseer: (And lo! the wicked) Kildah and his fellow disbelievers (verily will be in hell;

Arabic: يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
Tafseer: They will burn therein) they will enter the Fire (on the Day of Judgement) on the Day of Reckoning and Judgement between created beings,

Arabic: وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ
Tafseer: (And will not) i.e. the disbelievers (be absent thence) whence they enter it.

Arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
Tafseer: (Ah, what will convey unto thee) O Muhammad (what the Day of Judgement is!) what is the Day of Reckoning. (Again, what will convey unto thee) O Muhammad

Arabic: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
Tafseer: (what the Day of Judgement is!) what the Day of Reckoning is. He said this to arouse his astonishment, in order to magnify such a Day.

Arabic: يَوْمَ لاَ تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِنَفْسٍ شَيْئاً وَٱلأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ
Tafseer: Allah the explained to him, saying: (A day on which no soul) no believing soul (hath power at all) no power to save or intercede (for any (other) soul) for any disbelieving soul. (The (absolute) command) sentencing and judging between people (on that day is Allah's) is in Allah's hands; none other than Him has that in his power and none will challenge Him about it'.

Arabic: وَيْلٌ لِّلْمُطَفِّفِينَ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying: (Woe unto the defrauders): '(Woe) severe punishment (unto the defrauders) in weighing and measurement; this refers to the people of Medina who used to cheat in weighing and measurement before the coming of the Prophet (pbuh) and so this surah was revealed to the Prophet (pbuh) on his way when he was migrating to Medina:

Arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُواْ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
Tafseer: Allah then explained who these defrauders are, saying: (Those who when they take the measure from mankind) those who, when they buy from people and weigh or measure that which they buy for themselves, (demand it full) they weigh and measure their merchandise in full,

Arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَوْ وَّزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ
Tafseer: (But if they measure unto them) but when they measure for others (or weigh for them, they cause them loss) they decrease the measurement or the weight and behave very badly; it is also said that the above means: severe punishment on that day is unto the defrauders in the prayer, the poor-due, fasting and other acts of worship.

Arabic: أَلا يَظُنُّ أُوْلَـٰئِكَ أَنَّهُمْ مَّبْعُوثُونَ
Tafseer: (Do such (men)) those who deal in fraud in weight and measurement (not consider) not know and believe (that they will be raised again) brought back to life

Arabic: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
Tafseer: Unto an awful Day) the Day of Judgement whose horrors are great,

Arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ
Tafseer: (The day when (all) mankind stand) after emerging from the graves (before the Lord of the Worlds) the Lord of every living being who walks on the earth and the Lord of the dwellers of heaven? When the Prophet (pbuh) read to them this surah, they repented and started giving full weight and measurement.

Arabic: كَلاَّ إِنَّ كِتَابَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٍ
Tafseer: (Nay) truly, O Muhammad, (but the record of the vile) the works of the disbelievers (is in Sijjin

Arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَاكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ
Tafseer: Ah! what will convey unto thee what Sijjin is) what is in Sijjin! This is mentioned by way of aggrandizement of Sijjin.

Arabic: كِتَابٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
Tafseer: (A written record) He says: the works of the children of Adam are written on a green rock under the seventh earth; this is Sijjin.

Arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
Tafseer: (Woe) severe punishment (unto the repudiators) unto the deniers of faith and the resurrection (on that day) the Day of Judgement!

Arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
Tafseer: (Those who deny the Day of Judgement) and the Reckoning which will take place in it

Arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلاَّ كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Which none denieth) i.e. none denies the Day of Judgement (save each criminal transgressor) save each sinful and unjust person who transgresses against the Truth, such as al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah al-Makhzumi,

Arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ ٱلأَوَّلِينَ
Tafseer: (Who, when thou readest unto him) unto al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah (Our revelations) the Qur'an explaining the commands and prohibitions, (saith: (Mere) fables of the men of old) this is nothing but the lies and idle talk of the people of old.

Arabic: كَلاَّ بَلْ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ مَّا كَانُواْ يَكْسِبُونَ
Tafseer: (Nay) truly, O Muhammad, (but that which they have earned) which they have done and said in their state of idolatry (is rust upon their hearts) Allah has sealed the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Day of Judgement; it is also said that the accumulation of sins blackens the heart and this is what is meant by the rust of hearts.

Arabic: كَلاَّ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
Tafseer: (Nay) truly, O Muhammad, (but surely on that day) the Day of Judgement (they) i.e. the deniers of the Day of Judgement (will be covered from (the mercy of) their Lord) they will be prevented from beholding their Lord while the believers will behold Him.

Arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُواْ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
Tafseer: (Then lo! they verily will burn in hell) then they will enter the Fire,

Arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
Tafseer: (And it will be said (unto them)) the keepers of hell will say to them when they enter it: (This is that which ye used to deny) this is the chastisement which you used to claim it will never happen.

Arabic: كَلاَّ إِنَّ كِتَابَ ٱلأَبْرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ
Tafseer: (Nay) truly, O Muhammad, (but the record of the righteous) the works of those who are true in their faith (is in 'Illiyyin

Arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَاكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ
Tafseer: Ah, what will convey unto thee) O Muhammad (what 'Illiyyin is!) what is in 'Illiyyin.

Arabic: كِتَابٌ مَّرْقُومٌ
Tafseer: (A written record) it is said that the works of the righteous are written on tablets made of green chrysolite which are placed above the seventh heaven below the Throne of the Beneficent; this is 'Illiyyin,

Arabic: يَشْهَدُهُ ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
Tafseer: (Attested by those who are brought near (unto their Lord)) the works of the righteous are attested by the dwellers of heaven who are near their Lord.

Arabic: إِنَّ ٱلأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ
Tafseer: (Lo! the righteous) those who are true in their faith, and these are the ones who do not harm even the tiniest ant (verily are in delight) in Paradise whose bliss is everlasting,

Arabic: عَلَى ٱلأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
Tafseer: (On couches) in curtained canopies, (gazing) looking at the inhabitants of the Fire,

Arabic: تَعْرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
Tafseer: (Thou wilt know) O Muhammad (in their faces) the faces of the inhabitants of Paradise (the radiance of delight

Arabic: يُسْقَوْنَ مِن رَّحِيقٍ مَّخْتُومٍ
Tafseer: They are given to drink) in Paradise (of a pure wine, sealed) mixed,

Arabic: خِتَامُهُ مِسْكٌ وَفِي ذَلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَافِسُونَ
Tafseer: (Whose seal) whose end result (is musk. For this) for what I have mentioned (let (all) those who strive for bliss) let those who work and those who strive and those who hasten and those who take the initiative take the initiative.

Arabic: وَمِزَاجُهُ مِن تَسْنِيمٍ
Tafseer: (And mixed with water of Tasnim,

Arabic: عَيْناً يَشْرَبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُقَرَّبُونَ
Tafseer: A spring) gushing forth for them from the Garden of Eden (whence those brought near to Allah drink) those who are near to the Garden of Eden drink from the spring of Tasnim.

Arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُواْ كَانُواْ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُواْ يَضْحَكُونَ
Tafseer: (Lo! the guilty) the idolaters, Abu Jahl and his host (used to laugh at those who believed) used to mock and poke fun at 'Ali and his fellow believers,

Arabic: وَإِذَا مَرُّواْ بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ
Tafseer: (And wink one to another) they slander the believers (when they passed them) when the believers passed the disbelievers in their way to the Messenger of Allah (pbuh);

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوۤاْ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُواْ فَكِهِينَ
Tafseer: (And when they) the disbelievers (returned to their own folk, they returned jesting) they returned happy with their idolatry and mocking the believers;

Arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوۤاْ إِنَّ هَـٰؤُلاَءِ لَضَالُّونَ
Tafseer: (And when they saw them) and when they saw the Companions of the Prophet (pbuh) (they said) i.e. the disbelievers said: (Lo! These) the Companions of the Prophet (pbuh) (have gone astray) from true guidance.

Arabic: وَمَآ أُرْسِلُواْ عَلَيْهِمْ حَافِظِينَ
Tafseer: (Yet they were not sent) they were not set upon the believers (as guardians over them) as guardians over them or over their works.

Arabic: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُواْ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
Tafseer: (This day) which is the Day of Judgement (it is those who believe) in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an: i.e. 'Ali and his fellow believers (who have the laugh of disbelievers) who will laugh at the disbelievers,

Arabic: عَلَى ٱلأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
Tafseer: (On high couches) in curtained canopies, (gazing) looking at the people of the Fire being dragged therein.

Arabic: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُواْ يَفْعَلُونَ
Tafseer: (Are not the disbelievers paid) rewarded in the Hereafter (for what they used to do) except for what they used to do and say in the life of the world?'

Arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتْ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (When the heaven is split asunder): '(When the heaven is split asunder) by the clouds because of the descent of the Lord-a descent without any modality-and the angels and whatever Allah wills of His command.

Arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
Tafseer: (And attentive) and it obeys and listens (to her Lord in fear) and it befits her to do so,

Arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ
Tafseer: (And when the earth is spread out) like the spreading out of a flat plain; and it is also said this means: when the earth is removed from its place and then flattened.

Arabic: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ
Tafseer: (And hath cast out all that was in her) of corpses and treasures, (and is empty) from all of that

Arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
Tafseer: (And attentive) and obeys and listens (to her Lord in fear!) and it behoves her do so.

Arabic: يٰأَيُّهَا ٱلإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحاً فَمُلاَقِيهِ
Tafseer: (Thou, verily, O man) O disbelieving man, in reference to Abu'l-Aswad Ibn Kildah Ibn Usayd Ibn Khalaf, (art working) He says: you are working something in your state of disbelief and shall return with it (towards thy Lord) in the Hereafter (a work which you will meet (in His presence)) whether your work is righteous or evil.

Arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَـٰبَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ
Tafseer: (Then whoso is given his account) the account of his good works (in his right hand) in reference here to Abu Salamah Ibn 'Abd al-Asad

Arabic: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَاباً يَسِيراً
Tafseer: (He truly will receive an easy reckoning) this refers to his parade before Allah

Arabic: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُوراً
Tafseer: (And will return) in the Hereafter (unto his folk) whom Allah prepared for him in Paradise (in joy) with them.

Arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُ وَرَآءَ ظَهْرِهِ
Tafseer: (But whoso is given his account) the account of his evil deeds (behind his back) in his left hand, referring here to al-Aswad Ibn 'Abd al-Asad, the brother of Abu Salamah,

Arabic: فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُواْ ثُبُوراً
Tafseer: (He surely will invoke destruction

Arabic: وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيراً
Tafseer: And be thrown to scorching fire.

Arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فِيۤ أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُوراً
Tafseer: He verily lived joyous with his folk) he was happy with his folk,

Arabic: إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ
Tafseer: (He verily deemed that he would never return (unto Allah)) in the Hereafter.

Arabic: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيراً
Tafseer: (Nay, but lo! his Lord) when He created him (is ever looking on him!) knew that He will raise him again after death

Arabic: فَلاَ أُقْسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ
Tafseer: (Oh, I swear by the afterglow of sunset,

Arabic: وَٱللَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ
Tafseer: And by the night and all that it enshroudeth) and I swear by the night and that which returns to its place when the night falls,

Arabic: وَٱلْقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ
Tafseer: (And by the moon when she is at the full) for three nights: the nights of the thirteenth, fourteenth and fifteenth of the lunar month

Arabic: لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقاً عَن طَبقٍ
Tafseer: (That ye shall journey) the whole creation shall be transformed (on from plane to plane) from one state to another; from the time He created them until the time they die, and from the time they die until they enter either Paradise or hell: in all these times Allah transforms them from one state to another; it is also said that this means: you shall journey, O Muhammad, from one heaven to another on the day of the ascent; and it is also said that this means: this denier will go from one state to another, from the time he dies until he enters the Fire.

Arabic: فَمَا لَهُمْ لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ
Tafseer: (What aileth them) the disbelievers of Mecca; and it is said this refers to the three sons of 'Abd Yalayl al-Thaqafi: Mas'ud, Habib and Rabi'ah, the last two had later on accepted Islam (then, that they believe not) in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an.

Arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِىءَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقُرْآنُ لاَ يَسْجُدُونَ
Tafseer: (And, when the Qur'an is recited unto them) and when Muhammad (pbuh) recites the Qur'an to them explaining the commands and prohibitions, (worship not (Allah)) do not submit to Allah by believing in Allah's divine Oneness?

Arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ يُكَذِّبُونَ
Tafseer: (Nay, but those who disbelieve) the disbelievers of Mecca and those among the sons of 'Abd Yalayl who did not believe (will deny) will disbelieve in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an;

Arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ
Tafseer: (And Allah knoweth best what they are hiding) and Allah knows best what they say and do; and it is also said this means: Allah knows best what they hear and hide in their hearts.

Arabic: فَبَشِّرْهُمْ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
Tafseer: (So give them) so give, O Muhammad, to those who disbelieve in Allah (tidings of a painful doom) whose pain will extend to their hearts on the Day of Badr as well as in the Hereafter,

Arabic: إِلاَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
Tafseer: Allah then exempted from these the believers, saying: (Save those who believe) in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an (and do good works) and do acts of obedience privately between themselves and their Lord, (for theirs is a reward) in Paradise (unfailing) undiminished and unblemished; it is also said this means: they will not be constantly reminded about the blessings bestowed upon them; and it is also said this means: their good deeds will not be decreased after they reach old age or after they die'.

Arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْبُرُوجِ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (By the heaven, holding mansions of the stars): '(By the heaven, holding mansions of the stars) He says: Allah swears by the heaven which includes mansions of the stars; it is also said: He swears by the heaven which has mansions between heaven and earth; Allah knows that,

Arabic: وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْمَوْعُودِ
Tafseer: (And by the Promised Day) which is the Day of Judgement.

Arabic: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ
Tafseer: (And by the witness) the day of Friday (and that whereunto he beareth testimony) the day of 'Arafah and it is said it is the day of immolation; it is also said that 'the witness' refers to the children of Adam while 'that whereunto he bears testimony' refers to the Day of Judgement; and it is also said that 'the witness' is Muhammad (pbuh) while 'that whereunto he bears testimony' is his community; Allah swore by all these things that His chastisement of those who disbelieve in Him is very severe,

Arabic: قُتِلَ أَصْحَابُ ٱلأُخْدُودِ
Tafseer: ((Self-)destroyed were the owners of the ditch

Arabic: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلْوَقُودِ
Tafseer: Of the fuel-fed fire) slandered were the owners of the ditch; it is also said that they were believers who were killed by the disbelievers by means of fire in which they threw naphtha, oil and firewood,

Arabic: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ
Tafseer: (When they) i.e. the disbelievers (sat by it) by the ditch; and it is said: they sat on chairs when Allah burned them with the Fire,

Arabic: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
Tafseer: (And were themselves the witnesses) they used to testify that the believers were folk of error (of what they did to the believers) and it is said this means: they were present when they did this to the believers.

Arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُواْ مِنْهُمْ إِلاَّ أَن يُؤْمِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
Tafseer: (They had naught against them) against the believers nor did they find any fault with them (save that they believed in Allah, the Mighty) in His retribution against those who disbelieve in Him, (the Owner of Praise) for those who believe in Him,

Arabic: ٱلَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَاوَاتِ وَٱلأَرْضِ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
Tafseer: (Him unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty) the stores (of the heavens) rain (and the earth) plants; (and Allah is of all things the Witness) He is the Witness over their works.

Arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُواْ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُواْ فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
Tafseer: (Lo! they who persecute) those who burn and torture with fire (believing men) men who are true in their faith (and believing women) who are true in their faith (and repent not) from their idolatry and disbelief, (theirs verily will be the doom of hell) in the Hereafter, (and theirs the doom of burning) in the Fire; and it is also said: in the life of the world, for Allah had burned them with the Fire. These were people from Najran, and it is said from Mosul, who tortured and consequently killed a group of believers with fire in attempt to make them renounce their religion. The name of the king of these people is Yusuf, and it is said his name is Dhu'l-Nuwas.

Arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلأَنْهَارُ ذَلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
Tafseer: Allah then mentioned the believers who did not renounce their religion despite being tortured, saying: (Lo! those who believe) in Allah (and do good works) privately between themselves and their Lord, (theirs will be Gardens beneath which) beneath its trees and habitations (rivers flow) rivers of wine, water, honey and milk flow. (That is the Great Success) they earned the Garden and were saved from the Fire.

Arabic: إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! the punishment of thy Lord) the seizure of your Lord of those who disbelieve in Him (is stern.

Arabic: إِنَّهُ هُوَ يُبْدِىءُ وَيُعِيدُ
Tafseer: Lo! He it is Who produceth) He it is Who begins creation from a sperm drop, (then reproduceth) a new creation after death,

Arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلْوَدُودُ
Tafseer: (And He is the Forgiving) He forgives he who repents of disbelief and believes in Allah, (the Loving) He loves His friends; and it is also said this means: He loves those who obey Him,

Arabic: ذُو ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْمَجِيدُ
Tafseer: (Lord of the Throne of Glory) the good and fine Throne; and it is also said this means: Lord of the glorious Throne,

Arabic: فَعَّالٌ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ
Tafseer: (Doer of what He will) as He wills, He gives life and also takes it away.

Arabic: هَلُ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلْجُنُودِ
Tafseer: (Hath there come unto thee) O Muhammad-He asked His Prophet about this because He did not inform him about it before and then He did-(the story of the hosts

Arabic: فِرْعَوْنَ وَثَمُودَ
Tafseer: Of Pharaoh and (the tribe of) Thamud) and of those before and after them, what We did to them when they disbelieved?

Arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي تَكْذِيبٍ
Tafseer: (Nay, but those who disbelieve) the disbelievers of Mecca (live in denial) of Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an.

Arabic: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَآئِهِمْ مُّحِيطٌ
Tafseer: (And Allah, all unseen, surroundeth them) He says: He is Aware of them and of their works.

Arabic: بَلْ هُوَ قُرْآنٌ مَّجِيدٌ
Tafseer: (Nay, but it) i.e. the Qur'an which Muhammad (pbuh) recites to you (is a glorious Qur'an) is a noble and honoured Qur'an

Arabic: فِي لَوْحٍ مَّحْفُوظٍ
Tafseer: (On a guarded tablet) He says: it is written on a tablet that is protected from the devils'.

Arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning the interpretation of Allah's saying (By the heaven and the Morning Star): '(By the heaven and the Morning Star) He says: Allah swears by the heaven and the morning star

Arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَاكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ
Tafseer: (Ah, what will tell thee) O Muhammad (what the Morning Star is!) this is to arouse his astonishment.

Arabic: ٱلنَّجْمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ
Tafseer: Allah then explained by saying: (The piercing Star!) the bright, piercing star; this refers to the planet Saturn which shines at night and disappears during the day.

Arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
Tafseer: (No human soul) no believing or disbelieving soul-this is why Allah swore-(but hath a guardian over it) who record its words and deeds until he drives it into the grave.

Arabic: فَلْيَنظُرِ ٱلإِنسَانُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
Tafseer: (So let man) Abu Talib (consider from what he is created) from what his soul is created.

Arabic: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٍ دَافِقٍ
Tafseer: Allah then explained, saying: (He is created from a gushing fluid) into the womb of a woman

Arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِن بَيْنِ ٱلصُّلْبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ
Tafseer: (That issued from between the loins) of a man (and ribs) the ribs of a woman.

Arabic: إِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِ لَقَادِرٌ
Tafseer: (Lo! He) i.e. Allah (verily is Able to return him (unto life)) He is able to return that fluid from whence it came and He is Able to bring him back after death and revive him.

Arabic: يَوْمَ تُبْلَىٰ ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ
Tafseer: (On the day when hidden thoughts shall be searched out) when all the secrets that a person knows, and no one else other than him knows, become manifest.

Arabic: فَمَا لَهُ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلاَ نَاصِرٍ
Tafseer: (Then will he) Abu Talib (have no might) to defend himself (nor any helper) to shield him from Allah's chastisement.

Arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجْعِ
Tafseer: (By the heaven which giveth the returning rain) Allah swore by the heaven which accumulates clouds after cloud, year after year,

Arabic: وَٱلأَرْضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدْعِ
Tafseer: (And the earth which splitteth (with the growth of trees and plants)) and it is also said this means: and by the earth which has firm pillars

Arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلٌ فَصْلٌ
Tafseer: This is the reason why Allah swore: (Lo! this (Qur'an) is a conclusive word) a true exposition; it is also said this means: it is a judgement from Allah,

Arabic: وَمَا هوَ بِٱلْهَزْلِ
Tafseer: (It is no pleasantry) it is no falsehood.

Arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْداً
Tafseer: (Lo! They) i.e. the people of Mecca (plot a plot (against thee, O Muhammad)) they scheme in their state of disbelief, that is to say they bar people from Muhammad (pbuh) and from the Qur'an; it is also said this means: they plan, in Dar al-Nadwah, to kill you, O Muhammad!

Arabic: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْداً
Tafseer: (And I plot a plot (against them)) and I want to kill them, O Muhammad, on the Day of Badr.

Arabic: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلْكَافِرِينَ أَمْهِلْهُمْ رُوَيْداً
Tafseer: (So give a respite to the disbelievers. Deal thou gently with them for a while) give them a while until the Day of Badr'.

Arabic: سَبِّحِ ٱسْمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلأَعْلَىٰ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning the interpretation of Allah's saying (Praise the name of thy Lord the Most High): '(Praise the name of your Lord the Most High) He says: pray, O Muhammad, by the command of your Lord the Most High, Who is Higher than all things; it is also said that this means: remember, O Muhammad, the divine Oneness of your Lord; and it is said this means: say, O Muhammad, in your prostration “praise be to my Lord the Most High”,

Arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
Tafseer: (Who createth) every thing that has a soul, (then disposeth) He created them with two hands, two feet, two eyes, two ears and with other organs too;

Arabic: وَٱلَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ
Tafseer: (Who measureth) He made every male and female, (then guideth) then He made known and inspired how the male and female come; it is also said this means: He measured a person's creation, thus making him handsome or ugly, tall or short; it is also said this means: He measured felicity and wretchedness for His created beings, and so He made plain disbelief and faith, good and evil;

Arabic: وَٱلَّذِيۤ أَخْرَجَ ٱلْمَرْعَىٰ
Tafseer: (Who bringeth forth the pasturage) green pasture by means of the rain,

Arabic: فَجَعَلَهُ غُثَآءً أَحْوَىٰ
Tafseer: (Then turneth it) after being green (to russet stubble) i.e. He makes it dry and black when it exceeds a year.

Arabic: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلاَ تَنسَىٰ
Tafseer: (We shall make thee read (O Muhammad)) We shall teach, O Muhammad, the Qur'an; it is also said this means: Gabriel shall read to you the Qur'an (so that thou shalt not forget

Arabic: إِلاَّ مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ إِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
Tafseer: Save that which Allah willeth) and Allah willed that you do not forget; and the Prophet (pbuh) never forgot a bit of the Qur'an after this. (Lo! He knoweth the disclosed) He knows the works that are done and the words that are said in the open (and that which still is hidden) of secrets which you have thought about in yourself;

Arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
Tafseer: (And We shall ease thy way unto the state of ease) We shall make easy for you the conveyance of the message and all other acts of obedience.

Arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
Tafseer: (Therefore remind (men)) admonish by means of the Qur'an and through Allah, (for of use is the reminder) He says: admonition by means of the Qur'an and through Allah does not benefit except he who fears Allah, i.e. the believer.

Arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخْشَىٰ
Tafseer: (He will heed) he will take admonition by means of the Qur'an and through Allah (who feareth) Allah, i.e. the Muslim,

Arabic: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلأَشْقَى
Tafseer: (But the most hapless) the damned, as it is in Allah's foreknowledge, (will flout it) will steer away and avoid taking admonition by means of the Qur'an or through Allah,

Arabic: ٱلَّذِى يَصْلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰ
Tafseer: (He who will be flung to the great fire) he who will enter the Fire in the Hereafter, and there is no chastisement greater than the Fire

Arabic: ثُمَّ لاَ يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلاَ يَحْيَا
Tafseer: (Wherein) in the Fire (he will neither die) and thus be put out of his misery (nor live) a beneficial life.

Arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ
Tafseer: (He is successful) and saved (who groweth) he who takes admonition by means of the Qur'an and believes in Allah's divine Oneness,

Arabic: وَذَكَرَ ٱسْمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلَّىٰ
Tafseer: (And remembereth the name) the command (of his Lord) regarding the five daily prayers and other things, (so prayeth) the five daily prayers in congregation; this verse can also be understood to mean: he is successful and saved he who gives the charity of Fitr before going out to pray and mentions the name of his Lord saying " there is no deity save Allah " and upon going to prayer and returning from it says " Allah is the Most Great " and then prays the 'Id prayer with the Imam.

Arabic: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ ٱلْحَيَاةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
Tafseer: But ye prefer the life of the world) you chose to strive for the life of the world and preferred the reward of the life of the world to the reward of the Hereafter.

Arabic: وَٱلآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
Tafseer: (Although the Hereafter) striving for the Hereafter and the reward of the Hereafter (is better) than striving for the life of the world and reward of the life of the world (and more lasting.

Arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَفِي ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلأُولَىٰ
Tafseer: Lo! This) from His saying: (He is Successful) up to here (is in the former scrolls) in the Scriptures of the people of old,

Arabic: صُحُفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ
Tafseer: (The Book of Abraham and Moses) the Scripture of Moses is the Torah and only Allah knows about the Scripture of Abraham'.

Arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلْغَاشِيَةِ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning the interpretation of Allah's saying (Hath there come unto you): '(Hath there come unto you) He says: it has not come unto you, O Muhammad, before but now it has; it is also said that this means: it has come unto you (tidings of the Overwhelming) the news of the coming of the Hour? It is also said the Overwhelming refers to the Fire overwhelming its dwellers.

Arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَاشِعَةٌ
Tafseer: (On that day) the Day of Judgement ((many) faces) the faces of the disbelievers and hypocrites (will be downcast) abased because of the chastisement,

Arabic: عَامِلَةٌ نَّاصِبَةٌ
Tafseer: (Toiling) dragged in the Fire, (weary) in tiredness and strife; it is also said this means: toiling in the life of the world, weary in the Hereafter, this refers to the Christian monks and anchorites, and it is also said it refers to the Kharijites.

Arabic: تَصْلَىٰ نَاراً حَامِيَةً
Tafseer: (Scorched by burning fire) they enter the Fire whose heat is extreme,

Arabic: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ
Tafseer: (Drinking) in the Fire (from a boiling spring),

Arabic: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلاَّ مِن ضَرِيعٍ
Tafseer: (No food for them) in those abysmal pits (save bitter thorn fruit) the shabraq plant which grows in the roads of Mecca, which is eaten by camels when it is soft but when it is hard it becomes like the claws of cats.

Arabic: لاَّ يُسْمِنُ وَلاَ يُغْنِي مِن جُوعٍ
Tafseer: (Which doth not nourish nor release from hunger) when one eats it.

Arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَّاعِمَةٌ
Tafseer: (In that day other faces) the faces of true believers (will be calm) beautiful and radiant,

Arabic: لِّسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ
Tafseer: (Glad for their effort past) He says: they are pleased with the reward of their works,

Arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
Tafseer: (In a high Garden) in a high rank

Arabic: لاَّ تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لاَغِيَةً
Tafseer: (Where) in Paradise (they hear no idle speech) any oath whether it is true or false,

Arabic: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ
Tafseer: (Wherein) in Paradise (is a gushing spring) gushing with goodness, grace and mercy for them,

Arabic: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَّرْفُوعَةٌ
Tafseer: (Wherein) in Paradise (are couches raised) in the air for as long as its owners are away; it is also said that they are raised for its people.

Arabic: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَّوْضُوعَةٌ
Tafseer: (And goblets) round goblets that do not have handles, ears or nooses (set at hand) in their dwellings.

Arabic: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ
Tafseer: (And cushions ranged) against each other.

Arabic: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ
Tafseer: (And silken carpets spread) for its owners.

Arabic: أَفَلاَ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلإِبْلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
Tafseer: When the Prophet (pbuh) informed them of this, the disbelievers of Mecca said: " Bring us a sign to prove that Allah has sent you to us as a Messenger ". Therefore Allah said: (Will they not regard the camels, how they are created) with their strength and power, carrying burdens that no one else can carry?

Arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ
Tafseer: (And the heaven, how it is raised) how it is raised above creation, and no one can touch it?

Arabic: وَإِلَىٰ ٱلْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ
Tafseer: (And the hills, how they are set up) on earth, unmoved?

Arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ
Tafseer: (And the earth, how it is spread) over water? All these are signs for them.

Arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٌ
Tafseer: (Remind them) admonish them, (for thou art but a remembrancer) you are but a warner by means of the Qur'an; it is also said that this means: you are only an admonisher by the Qur'an and through Allah,

Arabic: لَّسْتَ عَلَيْهِم بِمُصَيْطِرٍ
Tafseer: (Thou art not) O Muhammad (at all a warder over them) you are not imposed on them such that you force them to accept faith.

Arabic: إِلاَّ مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
Tafseer: Later on, Allah commanded him to fight them, saying: (But whoso is averse and disbelieveth) except he who turns away from faith and disbelieves in Allah,

Arabic: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلأَكْبَرَ
Tafseer: (Allah will punish him) in the Hereafter (with direst punishment) i.e. with the punishment of the Fire.

Arabic: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَآ إِيَابَهُمْ
Tafseer: (Lo! unto Us is their return) in the Hereafter.

Arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُمْ
Tafseer: (And Ours their reckoning) their steadfastness in the life of the world and reward and punishment in the Hereafter'.

Arabic: وَٱلْفَجْرِ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning the interpretation of Allah's saying (By the Dawn): '(By the Dawn) He says: He swears by the dawn which is the breaking of day; it is also said it is the whole day; and it is also said that this refers to the dawn of the year.

Arabic: وَلَيالٍ عَشْرٍ
Tafseer: (And ten nights) the first ten nights of Dhu'l-Hijjah,

Arabic: وَٱلشَّفْعِ وَٱلْوَتْرِ
Tafseer: (And the Even) the day of 'Arafah and the day of immolation (and the Odd) three days after the day of immolation; it is also said that the Even refers to all prayers which are made of an even number of units: two or four units of prayer-the Subh, Zuhr, 'Asr and 'Isha' prayers-while the Odd refers to the prayers which consists of an odd number of units of prayer such as the Maghrib and Witr prayers; it is also said that the Even refers to Heaven and earth, the life of the world and the Hereafter, Paradise and hell, the Throne and the Stool, the sun and the moon, while the Odd refers to everything that is odd in number; it is also said that the Even refers to the male and female, disbeliever and believer, the sincere and hypocrite, the righteous and the sinful, while the Odd refers to Allah.

Arabic: وَٱلَّيلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ
Tafseer: (And the night when it departeth) this refers to the night of Muzdalifah; it is also said this means: the night in which people come and go; Allah swore by all these things that: your Lord, O Muhammad, is ever Watchful. He says:

Arabic: هَلْ فِي ذَلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
Tafseer: (There) in that which I have mentioned (surely is an oath for thinking man.

Arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
Tafseer: Dost thou not consider) have you not been informed, O Muhammad, in the Qur'an (how thy Lord dealt with (the tribe of) 'Aad) the people of Hud, how Allah, Exalted is He, destroyed them when they disbelieved,

Arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلْعِمَادِ
Tafseer: (With many columned) powerful (Iram) the son of Iram; Iram is Shem son of Noah who had a son called Shim and the later had a son called Ham who himself had a son called 'Aad,

Arabic: ٱلَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي ٱلْبِلاَدِ
Tafseer: (The like of which was not created in the lands) the like of their strength and height were not created in the land; it is also said that Iram is the name of a town built by Shadid and Shaddad whose columns were of gold and silver and the like of its beauty was not created in the land;

Arabic: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُواْ ٱلصَّخْرَ بِٱلْوَادِ
Tafseer: (And with (the tribe of) Thamud) He says: and how He destroyed Thamud, the people of Salih, (who clove the rocks in the valley) of Qura;

Arabic: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِى ٱلأَوْتَادِ
Tafseer: (And with Pharaoh) and how He destroyed Pharaoh, (firm of right) Pharaoh erected four pillars to which he tied and tortured anyone with whom he was angry until the latter died, as he did with his wife Asiyah Bint Muzahim,

Arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوْاْ فِي ٱلْبِلاَدِ
Tafseer: (Who (all) were rebellious (to Allah) in these lands) they rebelled and declared their disbelief in the land of Egypt; it is also said that their transgression led them to this,

Arabic: فَأَكْثَرُواْ فِيهَا ٱلْفَسَادَ
Tafseer: (And multiplied iniquity) and multiplied killing innocent people and spread their idol worship (therein) in the land of Egypt?

Arabic: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ
Tafseer: (Therefore thy Lord poured on them the disaster of His punishment) your Lord sent on them a severe punishment.

Arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلْمِرْصَادِ
Tafseer: (Lo! thy Lord) O Muhammad (is ever watchful) He says: they, as well as all created beings, will have to go through Him; it is also said that this means: the angels of your Lord will be on the Bridge over hell stopping people at seven different stopping positions at which they will ask them about seven traits.

Arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلإِنسَانُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلاَهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيۤ أَكْرَمَنِ
Tafseer: (As for man) the disbelieving man, in reference here to Ubayy Ibn Khalaf; and it is also said: Umayyah Ibn Khalaf, (whenever his Lord trieth him) whenever his Lord tests him with wealth, richness or means of living (by honouring him) by giving him abundant wealth, (and is gracious unto him) and expands for him his means of living, (he saith: My Lord honoureth me) by giving me wealth and means of living.

Arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلاَهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيۤ أَهَانَنِ
Tafseer: (But whenever He trieth him) whenever He tests him with poverty (by straitening his means of life) by tightening his means of living, (he saith: My Lord despiseth me) by giving me poverty and tightening my means of living.

Arabic: كَلاَّ بَل لاَّ تُكْرِمُونَ ٱلْيَتِيمَ
Tafseer: (Nay) this is a reply to them: No, but the honour I bestow is due to My acknowledgment of some My servants and the success I give to them, while My despising is because I turn away from some servants and completely forsake them, (but ye (for your part) honour not the orphan) you do not acknowledge the right of the orphan when he is under your care.

Arabic: وَلاَ تَحَآضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ
Tafseer: (And urge not) yourselves or others (on the feeding of the poor) giving alms to the poor,

Arabic: وَتَأْكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكْلاً لَّمّاً
Tafseer: (And ye devour heritages) inheritances (with devouring greed

Arabic: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلْمَالَ حُبّاً جَمّاً
Tafseer: And love wealth with abounding love.

Arabic: كَلاَّ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلأَرْضُ دَكّاً دَكّاً
Tafseer: Nay) this is also a reply to them, (but when the earth is ground to atoms, grinding, grinding) He says: when the earth is quaked again and again,

Arabic: وَجَآءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلْمَلَكُ صَفّاً صَفّاً
Tafseer: (And thy Lord shall come) a coming without any modality (with angels, rank on rank) like the ranks of the people of the life of the world when praying,

Arabic: وَجِيۤءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلإِنسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
Tafseer: (And hell is brought near) with 70,000 registers, with each register 70,000 angels leading it to the place of mustering, and then they reveal them (that day) the Day of Judgement; (on that day man) the disbelieving man; i.e. Ubayy Ibn Khalaf and Umayyah Ibn Khalaf (will remember) will be admonished, (but how will the remembrance (then avail him)) when the time for being admonished has passed?

Arabic: يَقُولُ يٰلَيْتَنِي قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِي
Tafseer: (He will say: Ah, would that) wishing: if only (I had sent before me (some provision) for my life!) if only I have worked in my previous perishing life to this everlasting life.

Arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لاَّ يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُ أَحَدٌ
Tafseer: (None punisheth as He will punish on that day) on the Day of Judgement!

Arabic: وَلاَ يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُ أَحَدٌ
Tafseer: (None bindeth as He then will bind) this can also be understood to mean: none punishes like this and none will inflict that kind of punishment except Allah.

Arabic: يٰأَيَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفْسُ ٱلْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ
Tafseer: (But ah! thou soul at peace) which is safe from Allah's chastisement, true in its profession of Allah's divine Oneness, grateful for the blessings Allah bestowed upon it, patient with the trials of Allah, pleased with things decreed by Allah, and content with that which Allah gives!

Arabic: ٱرْجِعِي إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَّرْضِيَّةً
Tafseer: (Return unto thy Lord) return to that which Allah has prepared for you in the Garden; and it is also said this means: return to your master: the body, (content) with Allah's reward (in His good pleasure) because of its belief in Allah's divine Oneness!

Arabic: فَٱدْخُلِي فِي عِبَادِي
Tafseer: (Enter thou among My bondmen) enter you among My friends!

Arabic: وَٱدْخُلِي جَنَّتِي
Tafseer: (Enter thou My Garden) which I have prepared for you!'

Arabic: لاَ أُقْسِمُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
Tafseer: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (Nay, I swear by this city): '(Nay, I swear by this city) He says: I swear by the city of Mecca

Arabic: وَأَنتَ حِلٌّ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْبَلَدِ
Tafseer: (And thou art an indweller of this city) and it is also said that this means: Allah has made lawful for you in this city that which he did not make lawful to anyone before or after you; and it is also said that this means: you are excused regarding that which you do in this city.

Arabic: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ
Tafseer: (And the begetter and that which he begat) the begetter is Adam and that which his sons begat; and it is also said this means: the begetter refers to the person who can have children, whether this person is a man or a woman, while that which he begat refers to the men or women who cannot have children; Allah swore by all these,

Arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلإِنسَانَ فِي كَبَدٍ
Tafseer: (We verily have created man) i.e. Kildah Ibn Usayd (in an atmosphere) in an erect form; it is also said that this means: in strife with the matter of the life of this world and of the Hereafter; and it is also said this means: with strength and force:

Arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
Tafseer: (Thinketh he) does the disbelieving man think (that) because of his strength and force (none hath power over him?) i.e. Allah cannot seize and punish him.

Arabic: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالاً لُّبَداً
Tafseer: (And he) Kildah Ibn Usayd; and it is also said: al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah (saith: I have destroyed vast wealth) I have spent abundant wealth in enmity towards Muhammad, Allah bless him, and this did not benefit me:

Arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّمْ يَرَهُ أَحَدٌ
Tafseer: (Thinketh he) does the disbelieving man deem (that none beholdeth him) that Allah does not see his deeds whether he spends money or not?

Arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُ عَيْنَيْنِ
Tafseer: Allah then mentioned the blessings He bestowed upon him, saying: (Did We not assign unto him two eyes) with which he sees

Arabic: وَلِسَاناً وَشَفَتَيْنِ
Tafseer: (And a tongue) with which he speaks (and two lips) which he can join together or separate,

Arabic: وَهَدَيْنَاهُ ٱلنَّجْدَينِ
Tafseer: (And guide him to the parting of the mountain ways?) And We showed him the way of goodness and the way of evil; and it is also that this means: the way to the two breasts.

Arabic: فَلاَ ٱقتَحَمَ ٱلْعَقَبَةَ
Tafseer: (But he hath not attempted the Ascent) He says: but did he go beyond that hurdle which is the Bridge over hell?

Arabic: وَمَآ أَدْرَاكَ مَا ٱلْعَقَبَةُ
Tafseer: (Ah, what will convey unto thee) O Muhammad (what the Ascent is!) it is a smooth hurdle between Paradise and hell. Allah said this to arouse the Prophet's astonishment.

Arabic: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
Tafseer: ((It is) to free a slave) He says: its crossing requires the freeing of a slave; and it is also said this means: none will cross it save he who has freed a slave,

Arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ
Tafseer: (And to feed in the day of hunger) and hardship

Arabic: يَتِيماً ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ
Tafseer: (An orphan near of kin,

Arabic: أَوْ مِسْكِيناً ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ
Tafseer: Or some poor wretch in misery) and who has nothing,

Arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ آمَنُواْ وَتَوَاصَوْاْ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْاْ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
Tafseer: (And to be) in addition to this (of those who believe) in private between themselves and their Lord, in Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an (and exhort one another to perseverance) in fulfilling the obligations (and export one another to pity) towards the poor and needy.

Arabic: أُوْلَـٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ ٱلْمَيْمَنَةِ
Tafseer: (Their place will be on the right hand) those who are given their register in their right hands are the inhabitants of the Garden.

Arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ ٱلْمَشْأَمَةِ
